Suspicion soon turns to the four rivals for his mayoral chains in a forthcoming election. Neill Rea and Fern Sutherland star

programme.title: Father Brown

programme.title: Strike
programme.desc: Supermodel Lula Landry falls to her death from a Mayfair balcony and the police conclude that she committed suicide, but Lula's adoptive brother John Bristow believes she was murdered and that key evidence has been overlooked. He calls upon private investigator Cormoran Strike to examine the death further and the penniless and effectively homeless PI takes the case. Crime thriller based on books written by JK Rowling under the pseudonym Robert Galbraith, starring Tom Burke and Holliday Grainger

programme.title: The Split
programme.desc: Woken by an early morning phone call, Hannah sets off for Downing Street, where the Foreign Secretary's husband has been caught in an online hack of an illicit dating website called Indiana Ray. Elsewhere, travelling home from an evening out, Rose confesses to James she doesn't want children - ever. Later, at Ruth's house, a family dinner proves disastrous when Nina gets drunk and drops a bombshell about Nathan which threatens to tear Hannah's life apart. Abi Morgan's drama, starring Nicola Walker, Stephen Mangan and Deborah Findlay

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: While Rebus looks into the apparent suicide of a man at an investment bank, Clarke investigates a stabbing on the seedy Westmills estate. The inspector learns his victim had links to a chemical company building a new plant in the area, as well as an Angolan village where children have been used unscrupulously in drug testing - but before his latest informant can pass on vital evidence, she too is silenced. Drama, starring Ken Stott and Claire Price

programme.title: Damilola, Our Loved Boy
programme.desc: In November 2000, 10-year-old schoolboy Damilola Taylor was attacked and fatally wounded in Peckham, south London, a death that shocked the nation. This feature-length drama reveals the personal stories behind the headlines, exploring Damilola's journey from Lagos to London, and showing how Richard and Gloria Taylor coped with their personal lives as well as the pressure of the media as they fought for justice for the killing of their son. Babou Ceesay, Wunmi Mosaku and Sammy Kamara star, with Robert Pugh

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: With his friend in peril and a young woman kidnapped by the relentless serial killer, can Luther protect the innocent while preventing Cornelius's violent revenge from consuming him? Who is Luther willing to save, and who can't he bear to lose? Crime drama, starring Idris Elba and Ruth Wilson

programme.title: The Bill

Phil Hunter gets on the wrong side of his wife when she thinks he's being unfaithful again

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Polly Page is less than pleased when her hated cousin Michelle turns up asking her to track down a stalker, and Jack Meadows vows to help sexy suspect Rachel Heath _ although her future is looking decidedly bleak. On the streets of Sun Hill, June Ackland resolves to find the relatives of an elderly woman attacked by muggers. Linda Robson and Lysette Anthony guest star

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Valerie helps mother of five Betty come to terms with her sixth child's birth defect. The Turners oversee a measles vaccination trial at the clinic, but are concerned by an overly anxious first-time mother. They soon discover she is concealing a devastating loss, which could have serious repercussions. Nurse Crane decides to bring a taste of the seaside to Poplar for the Whitsun bank holiday, and Violet's political career goes from strength to strength as she wins the seat on the council for Poplar North

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Compeyson goes to desperate lengths to make Miss Havisham notice him, and Martha Cratchit's wedding plans are thrown into turmoil by an unexpected knock at the door. Omid Djalili, Christopher Fairbank, Anton Lesser and Caroline Quentin feature alongside Tom Weston-Jones, Tuppence Middleton and Phoebe Dynevor in this period drama, re-imagining the works of Charles Dickens as inter-connected tales

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Bob Cratchit fights to clear his name to enable him to return home in time for his daughter's wedding, however the evidence is stacked up against him. Meanwhile, Compeyson's behaviour leaves Amelia feeling confused but intrigued. Stephen Rea, Pauline Collins, Caroline Quentin, Tom Weston-Jones, Tuppence Middleton, Anton Lesser and Omid Djalili star in this period drama, which re-imagines the works of Charles Dickens as inter-connected tales, set in a fictional version of 19th century London

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Dwelling Place
programme.desc: Feature-length adaptation of the best-selling novel, telling the tale of a 16-year-old struggling to keep her five brothers and sisters out of the workhouse with the help of a kindly carpenter. Starring James Fox, Tracy Whitwell and Edward Rawle-Hicks

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Sister Boniface investigates a deadly magical mishap at the local talent show

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Alan Davies stars in a feature-length episode of the offbeat crime drama. Master of illusion Jonathan is called upon to solve several disappearances inside the gloomy attic of a vast Gothic house, but is completely baffled by the mystery, which for 70 years has been attributed to the ghost of a madman said to prey upon human flesh. When two women shelter from a thunderstorm there one night, the ominous presence claims another victim, leaving her friend - Joey Ross - determined to get to the truth of what happened. Jonathan finds himself working alongside Joey, and it seems his formidable powers of deduction are in danger of being eclipsed by her raw intuition. With Sheridan Smith as Joey

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Part one of two. Miles and Chandler's latest case takes them deep into the world of modern art after the discovery of a flayed human face at Whitechapel Gallery. Interpreting some Russian prison tattoos suggests a link to organised crime, but what is the significance of the mysterious footsteps heard in empty corridors at the police station? As the investigation progresses, the killer strikes again, leaving a coded message, and Buchan's desperate search for answers leads him on a dangerous path. Starring Phil Davis, Rupert Penry-Jones, and Steve Pemberton, who also wrote this episode

programme.title: Whitechapel
programme.desc: Part two of two. As the killer runs rings around the team, striking quickly and leaving coded messages at the crime scenes, Chandler and Miles start to question the motives behind the gruesome deeds. The investigation is then further hampered when a new eyewitness claims the murderer looks like an old lady, and as the body count rises, Buchan works hard to find a precedent - but his research looks set to put him in danger

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: Part two of two. With Luther dogged by ghosts from his past, a cold case might be the key to unlocking a mystery that's tormenting him. Meanwhile, with the cannibalistic serial killer still at large, Benny's hacking skills have revealed a list of hundreds of potential victims. Realising it's all part of a macabre end game, the detective is forced to put himself and new colleague Emma into the heart of danger to try and stop the killer. programme.title: Broken

There were mixed fortunes for British players on day seven last year, as Heather Watson lost 6-2, 6-4 to Germany's Jule Niemeier, but Cameron Norrie's excellent run continued when he prevailed in straight sets against America's Tommy Paul. Also on this day, Carlos Alcaraz's tournament came to an end when the Spaniard lost to Jannik Sinner of Italy in four sets

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the seventh day from the All England Club, where the fourth-round matches are scheduled to continue in the men's and ladies' singles. Novak Djokovic's recent dominance of the event continued at this stage last year when he dropped a set to wildcard Tim van Rijthoven but was otherwise very comfortable in a 6-2, 4-6, 6-1, 6-2 victory

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Charlotte Smith are in Spalding, South Lincolnshire - the historic hub of Britain's bulb and flower farming industry, to explore its rich heritage. The pair discover how the the current generation of farmers are shaping the future of the flower industry and find out about the economic changes growers have faced. Charlotte meets James Lacey who explains how sunflowers are produced, picked and packed at his family farm and his love of high-tech harvesting. Joe joins young grower Hannah Benson as she delivers hand-cut blooms to sell at the UK's oldest flower auction. Tom Heap reveals how a study using flower chemicals in feed could reduce livestock methane emissions, and Adam Henson discovers how planting trees within arable fields can revolutionise a small farm's income

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team head to Newby Hall & Gardens in Ripon, North Yorkshire. Treasures include an intriguing letter from Lord Nelson, politely replying to his optician just weeks before the Battle of Trafalgar. There's also a piece of the set from Live Aid in 1985, rescued from a skip, and an engagement ring picked up in a pawn shop. The Bradford Museum also launches an appeal to find the families related to the thousands of people in photos in their archive

programme.title: Rain Man (1988)
programme.desc: Brash yuppie car dealer Charlie discovers his deceased father has left the family fortune to Raymond, the autistic elder brother he never knew he had. In a bid to get his hands on the money, he tracks down and abducts Raymond - but the ensuing cross-country journey proves to be a profound learning experience for them both. Oscar-winning drama, starring Tom Cruise and Dustin Hoffman, with Valeria Golino, Gerald R Molen and Jack Murdock

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph catches up on the development of five flats in Crystal Palace while Martel Maxwell follows a group with potential in Stoke. Tommy Walsh talks to a teacher who has a vision to create a family home in Bexleyheath that combines a modern feel while retaining period features

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: At RAF Lakenheath, Michael Portillo discovers a slice of America dropped into the British countryside. In the market town of Brandon on the border between Norfolk and Suffolk, he visits Quorn Foods to find how a seemingly modern meat substitute emerged out of a post-war food crisis. Michael ends his journey in Cambridge, where he studied during the 1970s

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants tropical gingers and tomatoes and direct sowing beans, and Rekha Mistry's shares the secrets of her success for growing aubergines on her London allotment. Elsewhere, Joe Swift visits a stunning walled garden in Denbighshire, designed and planted by owners who love to recycle and repurpose as much as they can, and journalist Rosie Kinchen discusses how horticulture helped her deal with postnatal depression

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Politics UK
programme.desc: The week's political proceedings around the UK

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Live coverage of the fifth day from the All England Club, where the third round gets under way in the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Home favourite Heather Watson reached the fourth round of a Grand Slam singles tournament for the first time in her career following 7-6, 6-2 victory over Kaja Juvan on day five last year. She was followed on Court No. 1 by Elise Mertens and Angelique Kerber, with Mertens eliminating the 2018 champion following a 6-4, 7-5 victory. It was then the turn of one of the most talented players in the men's draw to shine, with 2022 US Open champion Carlos Alcaraz winning 6-3, 6-1, 6-2 against Oscar Otte

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the fifth day from the All England Club, where the third round continues in the men's and ladies' singles competitions

Carole is also back in the Garden for Wildlife where she is planting species that suit sunny conditions and that also give nature a helping hand. Brian Cunningham is considering a particular lily and it's back to this summer's project of creating a garden for a new-build home

programme.title: Gardeners' World

These include co-presenter Carol Klein's own creation, which has taken her three months to complete

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Qasa Alom presents highlights of the fifth day's play at the All England Club, featuring matches in the third round of the men's and ladies' singles. There were wins for British players Cameron Norrie and Heather Watson at this stage last year against Steve Johnson and Kaja Juvan respectively

programme.title: The Fast Show
programme.desc: A brother and sister discuss the joys of living on the Isle of Man, Unlucky Alf buys a parrot and a doctor jokes to a patient about cancer. Tommy Cockles talks about Bogart and Bacall, Bob Fleming tries to speak about fishing tackle, and Ron Manager waxes lyrical about alcohol

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from the second day of the Third Test in the five-match series, held at Headingley Stadium in Leeds. England have won their last four Tests at this venue, including a one-wicket triumph over the Aussies in 2019

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: Reality TV star Mark Wright embarks on an epic road trip across Britain in the company of his brother Josh and father Big Mark. Along the way they open up about things that they've never spoken about before. For Mark it's a chance to reconnect focus on the things in life that really matter, Big Mark wants to regain his confidence after almost losing his life to Covid, while for Josh, it's a chance to experience things he was never able to do while he was a professional footballer. Among other things, they tackle a white-knuckle mountain bike ride, sleep in an abandoned slate mine and reflect on a tough few years

programme.title: Inside the Iranian Uprising
programme.desc: In September 2022, a 22-year-old Iranian woman, Mahsa Amini, died in police custody. She had been arrested by Iran's religious police, accused of not wearing her hijab properly. The authorities said she had died of a heart attack, but rumours spread that she had been beaten on arrest. Furious citizens took to the streets in their thousands. In a country with no freedom of speech or free reporting, they filmed themselves. This documentary reveals what has been happening across Iran, revealing a regime under huge pressure, resorting to extreme cruelty to control its citizens

programme.title: The Trouble with Kanye
programme.desc: Award-winning journalist Mobeen Azhar investigates one of music's most troubling stories. Unfolding against the backdrop of Ye's recent behaviour and his rumoured 2024 presidential campaign, this feature documentary sees Azhar travel to the United States to try to discover how one of America's most celebrated artists became a megaphone for hate and division. Tracing a line from earlier controversies in his career to this current moment, Mobeen speaks to Dr Marcus Hunter about the impact of some of Ye's earlier statements, and explores the bigger picture- a surge of white nationalism and antisemitism across America and the world

programme.desc: Walter's pampered cat Clawdia persuades her way into the gang, and only Gnasher can tell that she has a hidden agenda to oust him from Dennis's life for ever

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Abby gives a health check to a giant panda, Joel hits the slopes with world champion snowboarder Mia Brookes, and social media star Fin Draper chats about making music

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall heads to Norway to dive with one of the planet's ultimate predators - the orca. Steve also takes a look at herring, which are one of the orca's favourite fish

programme.title: Pooch Perfect
programme.desc: In the semi-final, the last four competitors face a breed that judge Colin Taylor is world-famous for grooming - the lamb-like Bedlington terrier. In Dogology, crossbreed puppies enter the salon and the groomers must identify the breeds of their two parents. One of the most dramatic transformations takes place on the Dogwalk when the dogs take the shape of completely different animals, to the delight of their owners. Presented by Sheridan Smith

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present live coverage of the sixth day from the All England Club, where the third round is scheduled to continue in the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Amanda Anisimova came through a clash between two talented young Americans on day six last year when she prevailed 6-7, 6-2, 6-1 against Coco Gauff on Centre Court. Meanwhile, British hope Katie Boulter's tournament came to an abrupt end when she lost 6-1, 6-1 to Harmony Tan of France, but she will hope to fare better this time around, having won her first WTA title in the build-up to Wimbledon when she triumphed at the the Rothesay Open Nottingham

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present further live coverage of the sixth day from the All England Club, where the third round is scheduled to continue in the men's and ladies' singles competitions

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Mark Stacey and Catherine Southon are in Margam Country Park in south Wales to value items brought in by the public. Mark meets someone with an eye for a bargain, while Catherine is taken by a wonderful pink Rolls-Royce. Presenter Paul Martin also take the opportunity to visit the birthplace of one of his heroes - a Welshman who took Hollywood by storm

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Dr Xander Van Tulleken cruise across the Welsh border in a couple of large classic American motors, guided on their hunt for antiques by experts Irita Marriott and Serhat Ahmet. Xand and Serhat discover their shared love of ceramics and set out to find the perfect piece to take to auction, while Irita and Gethin face a battle for some porcelain pigs

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Prime Minister Winston Churchill is to visit Walmington-on-Sea, and there is a shooting contest between Captain Mainwaring's unit and a rival platoon from nearby Eastgate to see who will have the honour of guarding him. Classic comedy first aired in 1968, guest starring Barbara Windsor, with Arthur Lowe and John Le Mesurier

programme.title: The Joy of the Bee Gees
programme.desc: A profile of the pop group, following their journey from child stars on the Australian variety circuit to UK pop chart competitors of the Beatles in the late 1960s. The documentary analyses the highlights of the three Gibb brothers' careers, including the success of the Saturday Night Fever album, the creation of their 'medallion man' trademark look, their triumphant 1987 comeback, and their work with famed fellow performers such as Kenny Rogers & Dolly Parton, Barbra Streisand and Diana Ross. Featuring interviews with Barry Gibb, John Lydon, Guy Chambers, Mykaell Riley, Alexis Petridis and Ana Matronic

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Qasa Alom presents highlights of the sixth day's play at the All England Club, featuring matches in the third round, as the players continued their bids to win the singles titles claimed by Novak Djokovic and Elena Rybakina in 2022

programme.title: Bee Gees at the BBC and Beyond
programme.desc: A compilation of classic performances by the pop trio from the BBC archive. Including renditions of the brothers' most popular hits, 1960s appearances on European television performing I Started a Joke, footage from a Top of the Pops staging of World, and some later concerts from the 1990s

programme.title: TOTP2: Bee Gees Special
programme.desc: The band perform some of their favourite tracks, including How Deep Is Your Love and You Win Again, on an edition of the pop show originally broadcast in 2001

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from the day three of the Third Test in the five-match series, held at Headingley Stadium in Leeds. The sides last met here in this format in 2019, when England prevailed by one wicket, with current captain Ben Stokes inspiring with both bat and ball

programme.title: Pride Hits at the BBC
programme.desc: A musical celebration of Pride, with performances by artists including Kylie Minogue, Elton John, Lady Gaga, Frankie Goes to Hollywood, Dolly Parton and Dusty Springfield. Featuring a playlist including Relax, Smalltown Boy, Born This Way, I Will Survive and Glad to Be Gay

programme.title: The Macaluso Sisters (2020)
programme.desc: Five sisters live together in an apartment in Palermo, only for their relationships to be shattered when one of them accidentally dies. Drama, starring Alissa Maria Orlando, Susanna Piraino and Anita Pomario. In Italian

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At the RHS Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival, Arit Anderson, Toby Buckland and Adam Frost reveal the latest in floral fashions and share highlights of the show gardens and floral marquee. These include co-presenter Carol Klein's own creation, which has taken her three months to complete

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven and Margherita Taylor travel to the village of Charsfield in Suffolk to celebrate acclaimed rural writer Ronald Blythe, who died in January aged 100. They visit key locations of his work and explore traditional crafts. Margherita talks to nature writer Melissa Harrison, who was inspired to move to the region by Blythe's works, and John meets a proud Suffolk speaker who explains how the dialect evolved

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter and head gardener Scott Smith tackle some of the topical queries they have received from viewers. Carole is also back in the Garden for Wildlife to plant species that suit sunny conditions and also give nature a helping hand, while there is another report on this summer's project of creating a garden for a new-build home

programme.title: The Edible Garden
programme.desc: Alys Fowler shows how to stock up vegetables for the colder months of the year as she grows courgettes, squashes, kale and Jerusalem artichokes. She also learns how to preserve food by using easy pickling recipes, forages for seeds and plants winter crops to keep her going until the next spring

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present live coverage of the seventh day from the All England Club, where the fourth-round matches are scheduled to get under way in the men's and ladies' singles. 'Middle Sunday' was traditionally a rest day, but it was decided last year to introduce a full schedule to prevent the schedule becoming congested in the event of any weather-related delays. The crowd on the No. 2 Court were treated to a five-set epic, with David Goffin eventually prevailing against Frances Tiafoe. Meanwhile, 2017 French Open champion Jelena Ostapenko's tournament came to an end when she was beaten 5-7, 7-5, 7-5 by Tatjana Maria on the No. 1 Court

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present further live coverage of the seventh day from the All England Club, where the fourth-round matches are scheduled to conclude in the men's and ladies' singles

programme.title: The Second Best Exotic Marigold Hotel (2015)
programme.desc: With the original Best Exotic Marigold Hotel a roaring success, owner Sonny decides the time is right to expand his business empire. But to do so, he and the rest of the residents must pull out all the stops to impress a potential investor's inspector - a task that proves to be easier said than done. Comedy drama sequel, with Dev Patel, Maggie Smith, Judi Dench and Richard Gere

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: More live coverage of the seventh day from the All England Club, where the fourth-round matches are scheduled to conclude in the men's and ladies' singles. Ons Jabeur was the last player on the No. 1 Court to book her place in the quarter-finals last year when she overcame Elise Mertens 7-6, 6-4

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Qasa Alom presents highlights of the seventh day's play at the All England Club, featuring matches in the fourth round, as a full schedule of play was expected to take place on 'Middle Sunday' for only the second time in the history of the prestigious tournament

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan
programme.desc: Romesh heads to more countries that are rarely visited by tourists to get a sense of the local culture and find out if they deserve their reputation. In this first edition, he heads to Zimbabwe in the aftermath of Robert Mugabe's rule, to discover whether British people should be holidaying in the southern African country once again. He meets Chipo, a teacher who was born and raised in Harare under Mugabe's rule. She explains that although people have been coming to the country, few venture beyond Victoria Falls. She wants to show Rom what they are missing on a grand, epic road trip that takes in National Parks and close-up encounters with rhinos, elephants and the so-called 'cheetah ambassador'

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from the fourth day of the Third Test in the five-match series, held at Headingley Stadium in Leeds. England have won their last four Tests at this venue, including a one-wicket triumph over the Aussies in 2019

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: After renting for many years in London, actress Jill Halfpenny and her 13-year-old son Harvey made the big decision to start a new life in the North East, where Jill was brought up. They both love the sea views of their new home in Tynemouth, but the flat's layout is revealing its glitches. The kitchen is right at the back of the property, making it feel dark and disconnected, the bathroom has no windows and the only outside space is a tiny balcony. Using virtual reality techniques, architects Will Foster and Lynsey Elliot compete to remodel the property

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents topical debate from Fleetwood, Lancashire, with a panel of politicians and other guests facing questions from the audience

programme.title: Africa Rising with Afua Hirsch
programme.desc: In South Africa, once a byword for racial segregation under the apartheid regime, Afua Hirsch finds a country in transition with a new creativity emerging from the roots up in the townships, as the once-oppressed reclaim their art scene. She explores how far this process is driven by what locals call 'ekasi', the street-cool of the townships, and has a dance lesson from viral amapiano dance star Bontle Modiselle. She also gets a new tattoo at Soweto Ink, goes bike spinning on Soweto's streets and meets hair sculptor Lebohang Motaung, whose gravity-defying braiding is going mainstream

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from the second day of the Third Test in the five-match series, held at Headingley Stadium in Leeds. England have won their last four Tests at this venue, including a one-wicket triumph over the Aussies in 2019

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Simon Bates and Richard Skinner present the July 4 edition, featuring Tears for Fears, Simply Red, Dead or Alive, Fine Young Cannibals and the Damned

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Gary Davies introduces performances by Shakin' Stevens, A-ha, Black, Genesis, Jackie Wilson, Mel & Kim, Heart, the Christians, Pet Shop Boys and Terence Trent D'Arby in an edition first aired on July 9

programme.title: Radio 2 in Concert
programme.desc: Back in 1985, A-ha released their debut album, Hunting High and Low, and went on to take the UK charts by storm with smash hits that included Take On Me and The Sun Always Shines on TV. In 2010, the multi-platinum-selling trio retired, only to regroup five years later with the album Cast in Steel. To celebrate the reunion, the BBC Radio Theatre opened its doors to the Norwegian band for this Radio 2 special, in which they play a selection of songs old and new. Presented by Jo Whiley

programme.title: Radio 2 in Concert
programme.desc: A performance by the band at the BBC Radio Theatre in London. After a brief spell in a mod band, Roland Orzabal and Curt Smith formed a synth-pop duo in the early 1980s and achieved huge success on both sides of the Atlantic. As a result of such a huge fan base over 30,000 people applied to be part of the audience for this intimate gig. Here, the boys from Bath perform their classic hits, including Mad World, Shout, Everybody Wants to Rule the World and Sowing the Seeds of Love

programme.title: Annie Lennox: BBC One Sessions
programme.desc: The Academy Award-winning singer performs at LSO St Luke's, London, with members of the BBC Concert Orchestra. The session includes songs from the Eurythmics' back catalogue, together with material from her solo career. First shown in 2009

programme.title: Depeche Mode at 6 Music Festival 2017
programme.desc: Highlights of the band's headlining performance at the Barrowland Ballroom in Glasgow. The electro-pioneers' first live UK show in four years saw them perform tracks from their 2017 album Spirit, along with a few classic hits. The last time Dave Gahan, Martin Gore and Andy Fletcher performed at the 2,000 capacity venue was in 1984 for their Some Great Reward tour

programme.title: The Old Grey Whistle Test
programme.desc: Annie Nightingale presents a Christmas Eve performance by the punk princess at the Theatre Royal, Drury Lane, with a band including acclaimed drummer Simon Phillips. Songs include the hits It's a Mystery and I Want to Be Free

programme.title: Radio 2 in Concert
programme.desc: Back in 1985, A-ha released their debut album, Hunting High and Low, and went on to take the UK charts by storm with smash hits that included Take On Me and The Sun Always Shines on TV. In 2010, the multi-platinum-selling trio retired, only to regroup five years later with the album Cast in Steel. To celebrate the reunion, the BBC Radio Theatre opened its doors to the Norwegian band for this Radio 2 special, in which they play a selection of songs old and new. Presented by Jo Whiley

programme.title: Annie Lennox: BBC One Sessions
programme.desc: The Academy Award-winning singer performs at LSO St Luke's, London, with members of the BBC Concert Orchestra. The session includes songs from the Eurythmics' back catalogue, together with material from her solo career. First shown in 2009

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from the day three of the Third Test in the five-match series, held at Headingley Stadium in Leeds. The sides last met here in this format in 2019, when England prevailed by one wicket, with current captain Ben Stokes inspiring with both bat and ball

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc: Paul Rose recounts the story of how American submarine USS Squalus became stranded in the Atlantic in 1939 after a fault caused a partial flooding of the vessel and the deaths of 26 men. The surviving 33 crew members were rescued by divers under the direction of inventor Charles Momsen, employing his pioneering underwater escape apparatus

programme.title: Beck
programme.desc: A man is found dead at a flea market in southern Stockholm. At first it looks like a robbery gone wrong but the investigation takes an unexpected turn when the secret police take an interest in the case. Crime drama, starring Peter Haber and Jennie Silfverhjelm. In Swedish

programme.title: Blankety Blank
programme.desc: Comic game show hosted by the outrageous Lily Savage, as portrayed by Paul O'Grady. Helping the contestants, as they compete for an array of unlikely prizes, are celebrity panellists Barbara Windsor, Ant McPartlin, Roy Barraclough, Roger Black, Jane Danson and Lorraine Kelly. First broadcast in 1999

programme.title: Parkinson: The Interviews
programme.desc: The chat show host recalls memorable moments from his encounters with Peter Cook, one of the most acclaimed British humorists of the 20th century. Includes contributions from Cook's long-time comedy partner Dudley Moore

programme.title: Hancock's Half Hour
programme.desc: Hancock decides to invest in a new camera - which Sid sees as the perfect opportunity to make some money. Classic comedy from the pen of Galton and Simpson, starring Tony Hancock and Sidney James. Originally broadcast in 1960

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Bob and Terry decide to chat up a couple of girls in a restaurant to see if they are still attractive to the opposite sex. Comedy, starring James Bolam and Rodney Bewes

programme.title: Britain's Ancient Capital: Secrets of Orkney
programme.desc: An investigation into how recent archaeological finds on the archipelago indicate that Orkney was the cultural capital of Stone Age Britain and the birthplace of the stone circle cult. Chris Packham uncovers the secrets revealed by the DNA of Orkney's unique vole, Neil Oliver explores tombs and monuments, Shini Somara experiments to discover how ancient Orcadians could have moved giant blocks of stone over rough ground, and Andy Torbet climbs a challenging sea-stack to unlock the story of Orkney's unusual geology

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc: Paul Rose recounts the story of how American submarine USS Squalus became stranded in the Atlantic in 1939 after a fault caused a partial flooding of the vessel and the deaths of 26 men. The surviving 33 crew members were rescued by divers under the direction of inventor Charles Momsen, employing his pioneering underwater escape apparatus

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part documentary, Robert Winston explores the treatment of ailments before the advent of the National Health Service, revealing that few could afford to seek medical attention in the early 20th century. Archive footage and personal testimonies tell how ordinary people, doctors and nurses coped with a system ill-equipped to deal with sickness and disease in the years preceding the Second World War

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Action from the fourth day of the Third Test in the five-match series, held at Headingley Stadium in Leeds. England have won their last four Tests at this venue, including a one-wicket triumph over the Aussies in 2019

programme.title: A Midsummer Night's Dream from Shakespeare's Globe
programme.desc: Emma Rice's colourful production of Shakespeare's popular comedy, fusing music, dance and comedy. It's the story of four runaway lovers who find themselves in the forest outside of Athens, where they get caught up in a dispute between the king and queen of the fairies, just as a troupe of amateur actors is trying to rehearse a play. Between these two unlikely groups flies the michievous fairy Puck, armed with a wicked sense of humour and a love potion capable of making anyone fall in love with the first person they set eyes upon. Meow Meow and Ncuti Gatwa lead the cast

programme.title: Britain's Ancient Capital: Secrets of Orkney
programme.desc: Andy Torbet and local seafaring volunteers build a boat made of just willow and cow hide, and set out to cross the dangerous Pentland Firth as the ancient Orcadians would have done. Neil Oliver investigates the extraordinary discovery of some human bones, Chris Packham goes in search of whales and Shini Somara uncovers the powers of the tides

programme.title: Vienna: Empire, Dynasty and Dream
programme.desc: Simon Sebag Montefiore examines the transformation of Vienna into a great cultural capital after the Ottoman threat receded at the end of the 17th century. The city, no longer an outpost defending the West from Islamic invaders, was rebuilt and the Habsburgs vowed their empire and imperial capital would become the most glittering in the world, a magnet for musicians including Mozart, Haydn and Beethoven

programme.title: Mark Gatiss on John Minton: The Lost Man of British Art
programme.desc: The League of Gentlemen star Mark Gatiss examines the life and career of largely forgotten English artist John Minton, who was one of the leading figures in post-war British art

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: The documentary exploring health care before the arrival of the NHS concludes, revealing how Victorian hospitals - often seen as a last resort for the destitute rather than a place of healing - transformed into the modern centres of medicine they have become today. Includes archive footage and first-hand accounts from patients, doctors and nurses from an era when infectious disease was virtually untreatable. Narrated by Robert Winston

programme.title: Vienna: Empire, Dynasty and Dream
programme.desc: Simon Sebag Montefiore examines the transformation of Vienna into a great cultural capital after the Ottoman threat receded at the end of the 17th century. programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present live coverage of the fifth day from the All England Club, featuring third-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Novak Djokovic then continued his march to a fourth successive Wimbledon title with a 6-0, 6-3, 6-4 victory over his Serbian compatriot Miomir Kecmanovic

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the fifth day from the All England Club, featuring third-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Cameron Norrie maintained British interest in the men's event at this stage last year with a dominant 6-4, 6-1, 6-0 win against America's Steve Johnson. There was also disappointment for Johnson's veteran compatriot John Isner on the No.2 Court, when he was defeated 6-4, 7-6, 6-3 by talented Italian Jannik Sinner

programme.title: Rewind: 60 Years of Welsh Pop
programme.desc: This edition revisits a cultural movement that began in the late 1990s. Welsh music, film and the arts experienced a resurgence and Cool Cymru was born. Stereophonics, Manic Street Preachers and Catatonia were proudly wearing the red dragon of Wales on their sleeve and were making waves across the globe. Super Furry Animals, Gorky's Zygotic Mynci, Feeder and Duffy also made a huge impact on the scene

programme.title: Thelma & Louise (1991)
programme.desc: Two world-weary friends flee their dull dead end lives for a weekend road trip. However, when they kill a would-be rapist in self-defence, they make a fateful decision to run from the law, sparking a chain of events destined to end in tragedy. Ridley Scott's drama, starring Geena Davis, Susan Sarandon, Harvey Keitel, Michael Madsen and Brad Pitt

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Actor Jonny Cotsen sets out to discover why he was brought up as if he could hear, and whether it is too late to embrace his deaf identity. The film combines reconstructions that delve into Jonny's past with striking sound design, which helps a hearing audience understand the world he lives in today

programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present live coverage of the sixth day from the All England Club, where the third round is scheduled to continue in the men's and ladies' singles competitions. British wildcard Liam Broady's tournament came to an end at this stage last year on Court No.1 when he was defeated in straight sets by Australia's Alex De Minaur. programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the sixth day from the All England Club, where the third round is scheduled to conclude in the men's and ladies' singles competitions. Eventual runner-up Nick Kyrgios overcame fourth seed Stefanos Tsitsipas in four sets at this stage last year. There were also victories for two Spaniards on Centre Court, with Paula Badosa and Rafael Nadal overcoming Petra Kvitova and Lorenzo Sonego respectively. Elsewhere, 2019 champion Simona Halep prevailed 6-4, 6-1 against Magdalena Frech

programme.title: Champion
programme.desc: Bosco has a visit from the bailiffs, and to add to his humiliation, the incident is filmed and posted online. The pressure to deliver a new single and turn his fortunes around drives him into a panic attack. Vita records a new single, but feels she is being pressured by her management into choices she does not want to make. Beres reveals his plans to set up his own record label and run it with Bosco - which prompts the desperate rapper to sign a contract without reading it

programme.title: The Lady in the Van (2015)
programme.desc: The true story of writer Alan Bennett's friendship with an eccentric homeless woman, whom he befriended in the 1970s before allowing her to park her dilapidated Bedford van outside his Camden home, where she ended up staying for 15 years. Comedy-drama, starring Maggie Smith, Alex Jennings, Roger Allam and Jim Broadbent

programme.title: The Happy Prince (2018)
programme.desc: Biographical drama about the final years of Oscar Wilde. After his release from Reading prison for gross indecency, the once celebrated and now notorious playwright lives out his final years in self-imposed exile in France. He is visited by loyal friends and lovers, but none seems able to divert him from resuming the destructive relationship with Alfred 'Bosie' Douglas. Written by directed by, and starring Rupert Everett, with Colin Firth, Tom Wilkinson, Anna Chancellor, Colin Morgan and Emily Watson

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Isa Guha and Clare Balding present live coverage of the seventh day from the All England Club, featuring fourth-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles. There were mixed fortunes for British players on day seven last year, as Heather Watson lost 6-2, 6-4 to Germany's Jule Niemeier, but Cameron Norrie's excellent run continued when he prevailed in straight sets against America's Tommy Paul. programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the seventh day from the All England Club, where the fourth-round matches are scheduled to continue in the men's and ladies' singles. Novak Djokovic's recent dominance of the event continued at this stage last year when he dropped a set to wildcard Tim van Rijthoven but was otherwise very comfortable in a 6-2, 4-6, 6-1, 6-2 victory

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: In the conclusion of a two-part special where the same teams do battle across two episodes. The guests are former Wales cross-code rugby star Scott Quinnell, ex-England goalkeeper Rachel Brown-Finnis, Great Britain sprinter Harry Aikines-Aryeetey and world champion swimmer Karen Pickering. With team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness

programme.title: Match of the Day Wales Live
programme.desc: USA Women v Wales Women (Kick-off 9.00pm). Catrin Heledd presents coverage of the friendly at PayPal Park in San Jose. The Americans are fine-tuning their preparations for the World Cup, as they look to triumph in the competition for the third successive time. This is sure to be a tough test for Gemma Graingers side, but they go into this match unbeaten in their last six matches since an agonising extra-time loss to Switzerland in the World Cup play-offs. With analysis from Nia Jones and Katie Sherwood

programme.title: Talk Disability: Invisible Disabilities
programme.desc: Welsh Paralympian Olivia Breen discusses her life and bouncing back from setbacks to become a multiple Paralympic and World Champion in sprint and long jump. From her very first sports day when she was five, Olivia knew running was for her, and never gave up on her dream. We hear from Olivia on the highs and lows of becoming a multiple Paralympic and World Champion

programme.title: Rain Man (1988)
programme.desc: Brash yuppie car dealer Charlie discovers his deceased father has left the family fortune to Raymond, the autistic elder brother he never knew he had. In a bid to get his hands on the money, he tracks down and abducts Raymond - but the ensuing cross-country journey proves to be a profound learning experience for them both. Oscar-winning drama, starring Tom Cruise and Dustin Hoffman, with Valeria Golino, Gerald R Molen and Jack Murdock

programme.desc: Further live coverage of the fifth day from the All England Club, featuring third-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles competitions. There was also disappointment for Johnson's veteran compatriot John Isner on the No.2 Court, when he was defeated 6-4, 7-6, 6-3 by talented Italian Jannik Sinner

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Keen to take advantage of free tickets to Adventure Canyon Theme Park, Lee takes Mollie out of school for a day and gets into trouble with her new head teacher, Miss Anstis. Desperate for a more adequate explanation, he decides to claim the youngster was due to attend a dental check-up. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton, with Selina Griffiths

programme.title: Queen of Oz
programme.desc: After running into her old school bully Jessica, at the opening of a new maternity ward, Georgie decides to host a dinner party for her in the hopes that she can revel in her former aggressor's life struggles since they last met. Unfortunately for Georgie, it turns out that Jessica's life has been a charmed one. As tensions rise, Georgie is forced to confront old grudges and the night soon takes a downward turn. Comedy, starring Catherine Tate

programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Wimbledon 2023
programme.desc: Further live coverage of the seventh day from the All England Club, where the fourth-round matches are scheduled to continue in the men's and ladies' singles. Novak Djokovic's recent dominance of the event continued at this stage last year when he dropped a set to wildcard Tim van Rijthoven but was otherwise very comfortable in a 6-2, 4-6, 6-1, 6-2 victory

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Charlotte Smith are in Spalding, South Lincolnshire - the historic hub of Britain's bulb and flower farming industry, to explore its rich heritage. The pair discover how the the current generation of farmers are shaping the future of the flower industry and find out about the economic changes growers have faced. Charlotte meets James Lacey who explains how sunflowers are produced, picked and packed at his family farm and his love of high-tech harvesting. Joe joins young grower Hannah Benson as she delivers hand-cut blooms to sell at the UK's oldest flower auction. Tom Heap reveals how a study using flower chemicals in feed could reduce livestock methane emissions, and Adam Henson discovers how planting trees within arable fields can revolutionise a small farm's income

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team head to Newby Hall & Gardens in Ripon, North Yorkshire. Treasures include an intriguing letter from Lord Nelson, politely replying to his optician just weeks before the Battle of Trafalgar. There's also a piece of the set from Live Aid in 1985, rescued from a skip, and an engagement ring picked up in a pawn shop. The Bradford Museum also launches an appeal to find the families related to the thousands of people in photos in their archive

programme.title: Rain Man (1988)
programme.desc: Brash yuppie car dealer Charlie discovers his deceased father has left the family fortune to Raymond, the autistic elder brother he never knew he had. In a bid to get his hands on the money, he tracks down and abducts Raymond - but the ensuing cross-country journey proves to be a profound learning experience for them both. Oscar-winning drama, starring Tom Cruise and Dustin Hoffman, with Valeria Golino, Gerald R Molen and Jack Murdock

In a bid to get his hands on the money, he tracks down and abducts Raymond - but the ensuing cross-country journey proves to be a profound learning experience for them both. Oscar-winning drama, starring Tom Cruise and Dustin Hoffman, with Valeria Golino, Gerald R Molen and Jack Murdock

programme.desc: Artist Tracey Emin talks to John Wilson about the experiences that have shaped her life and career. In a deeply personal interview, Emin speaks about recently undergoing treatment for cancer, and about the two abortions which have had a profound impact on her artistic output. She also discusses the extraordinary effect that a painting by Mark Rothko had on her as a young woman, her affinity with the work of Edvard Munch, and her friendship with David Bowie.

programme.desc: Following the activities of a 10-week-old polar bear being raised by his mother in the Canadian Arctic. programme.title: Folk Prom

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Playing against each other today are married London couple Jon and Anushka, scuba diving fanatics Jerry and Amy, and Bournemouth couple Kenneth and Raymond. Adil Ray presents

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Rob, Cydney, Pauline and Joel pit their wits against quiz genius the Chaser. Answering general knowledge questions, they each add as much money as they dare to the jackpot - but if anyone is caught they're out for good, leaving fewer players for the final chase

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Amelia's worries are heightened, Charity and Marlon are peeved, and Gabby is not in the mood for celebrating

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: An exhausted Gemma seeks respite from childcare duties, Ryan is a victim of his own success at the bistro, and Stephen drops hints that Elaine is suffering from depression

programme.title: Riches
programme.desc: Refusing to accept defeat, Claudia and Gus meet with a lawyer to figure out how they can get the business back in their hands. Nina and Simon get a brazen introduction to how Stephen ran the business on their first day at Flair & Glory. And with Maureen ready to make a break from her secretarial role, Nina pleads with her to stay for a few months longer while she gets to grips with her late father's business

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Hard-hitting action from the world of All Elite Wrestling - the roster features world-class talent including Jon Moxley, Chris Jericho, Bryan Danielson and Claudio Castagnoli, and many more who bring a freshness and energy into professional wrestling

programme.title: The Masked Singer US
programme.desc: The American version of the show in which mystery celebrities battle it out in a singing contest while dressed head to toe in elaborate costumes

programme.title: Winning Combination
programme.desc: Omid Djalili hosts the quiz in which nine contestants are each assigned a number between one and nine, with the four that make the final trying to win the jackpot defined by those numbers. Each player's number is also the total of questions they must answer correctly in the final game against the clock

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Game show that sees teenage presenter Danny Murphy take on some of the craziest dares, from rock climbing to racing a hovercraft! In this episode, Danny must tackle nearly 40 high-rope obstacles and collect a set of Dare Master flags to avoid a messy forfeit.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. With Gena and Malcolm out for the evening, Lloyd is left in charge of PB and 224 maggots - how hard can maggotsitting be? Keen to get his duties over as quickly as possible, Lloyd skimps on the bedtime story, prompting a mass exodus of maggots!

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd adopts a tardigrade as a pet in spite of his parents warning that they never live for long. Regardless of his efforts to keep Nutbum alive, Lloyd finds it apparently dead the next day - thankfully, Cornea knows exactly what to do!

programme.title: Looney Tunes Cartoons
programme.desc: Classic cartoon capers

programme.title: Mystery Lane
programme.desc: Animated series about a young guinea pig and her little brother, who look to solve police investigations. Flash, the greyhound race champion, disappears from his ultra-secure pen in unfathomable circumstances the night before an important race.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: The teenage superheroes fight to save the world while getting up to mischievous antics

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: Driving outside Shreveport, Louisiana, our gang of mystery solvers is run off the road by a shooting star that crashes down in the middle of the large ranch belonging to none-other than famous football hall of famer and TV sports host, Terry Bradshaw. Upon further investigation, the 'shooting star' turns out to be a spaceship unleashing an alien monster on the local countryside! The gang and Mr. Bradshaw work together to get to the bottom of this space alien mystery and figure out what this alien is really after - championship rings or giant doughnuts

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined at the house by Homes Under the Hammer presenter Martin Roberts and former Welsh rugby union star Scott Quinnell, with recipes for tagine, jalfrezi chicken and steak. Plus, chefs Sabrina Gidda and Daniel Galmiche serve up some mouth-watering dishes of their own

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner demonstrate dishes perfect for feeding a crowd, starting with vibrant and tasty crab and roasted tomato bruschettas, and Indonesian-inspired pork chops with a gado gado salad. John makes seafood skewers great for the barbeque or the griddle, with a dessert of burnt Basque cheesecake, served with a decadent caramel sauce

programme.title: James Martin's Great British Adventure
programme.desc: The chef's culinary tour of Britain continues in Scotland with a trip to Blair Castle in the Highlands, where he takes a tour of the grounds and cooks venison with beetroot and blackberries in the castle's walled garden. Later, James gets a masterclass in Highland gaming as two young brothers David and Harry share the secrets to the famous caber toss

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani and Ed Chamberlin present coverage from Sandown Park, where the Coral-Eclipse is the feature race. Plus, three races from Haydock Park, including the Lancashire Oaks. With analysis from Jason Weaver and Megan Nicholls, reports by Matt Chapman, Oli Bell and Leonna Mayor, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Moonraker (1979)
programme.desc: James Bond's investigations into the mysterious disappearance of a space shuttle lead him to a sinister industrialist, who is plotting to wipe out most of the human race. The secret agent also faces a rematch with his old enemy, metal-toothed hitman Jaws. Spy adventure, starring Roger Moore, Michael Lonsdale, Richard Kiel and Lois Chiles

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents a special Emmerdale episode of the quiz show, as celebrity contestants Anthony Quinlan, Louisa Clein, James Moore and Dominic Brunt pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for charity. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Crime
programme.desc: Lennox struggles with his sobriety while hunting for Britney's killer and charismatic French detective Louis LeBlanc arrives to investigate the death of the French couple. Gary Franklin confesses to the murder of Britney and other young girls, but Lennox suspects he's merely a fantasist, then discovers lead suspect Graham Cornell is missing and was having an affair with MSP Richie Gulliver

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Keen to prove that he is hard-working to Queen Libby and his parents, Lloyd volunteers to work in the ant colony for a day, swapping with ant Annie 209 to replace him at home. However, things don't go to plan, and Lloyd creates chaos in the colony...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd tries to educate PB about the danger of spiders by luring one out with a decoy fly - his clumsy attempts attract a curious spider called Julie, who PB immediately wants to befriend. Can Lloyd accept that some spiders may not be all that bad?

programme.desc: Classic cartoon capers

programme.title: Looney Tunes Cartoons
programme.desc: Classic cartoon capers

programme.title: Mystery Lane
programme.desc: Animated series about a young guinea pig and her little brother, who look to solve police investigations. Champollion, the parrot of the famous archeologist, Sir Arthur Bones, calls upon Clever when his master is abducted by a humanoid robot after localising the famous Templars' treasure.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam is desperate to join an Endangered Species Protection Association and asks the Scepter for the power to be really funny, so she can win the jury's attention during her online interview. But, the half power gives her a clown's appearance! A silly costume that's impossible to take off! When she goes to look for Mo, Sam is snapped up by Mr. Brick - who, it so happens, used to be a professional clown himself!

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mo is given endless hours of detention and he's in despair: will he ever have a free Wednesday afternoon again? Amber explains that he can cancel detention hours by doing good deeds for the school. But given his amount of detention, he'll have to perform civic actions that no one has ever managed to complete. To achieve all these tasks, Mo asks the Scepter to grant him ALL super powers

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: Scooby and Shaggy meet up with their biker buddy, Axl Rose, on a tour of famous roadside diners along iconic Route 66.

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Katie Piper's Breakfast Show
programme.desc: Radio and TV presenter Dev Griffin joins Katie on the show, while there os advice from experts and tips for entertainment in the week ahead

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Actress Joanna David chats to Alan at Manor Farm about her time on Celebrity Gogglebox, while floral designer Simon Lycett shows off an autumn bouquet. Plus, the rare-breed sheep leading the way in British fine wool, and a look at the best in British craft beer

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team reveal how adding water can transform any size garden, creating two incredible water gardens, one outside and one inside. In Kent, Alan, Frances Tophill and David Domoney build a stunning outdoor space in a small plot featuring three different but equally spectacular water features. Meanwhile, Katie Rushworth reveals how to build an indoor water feature that can transform a bare corner of a home

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen return to host the celebrity cookery competition, as eight stars and their chef mentors compete in culinary cook-offs. The famous faces taking part are Bafta-winning actor Jason Watkins, former boxer Chris Eubank, Gavin & Stacey star Joanna Page, Coronation Street's Samia Longchambon, singer and TV personality Peter Andre, Busted's Matt Willis, Steps' Claire Richards and Love Island star Indiyah Polack

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Masked Singer US
programme.desc: In the first of two-part season finale, the winners of Group A and Group B perform festive songs Holly Jolly Christmas and Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates another comical selection of mishaps sent in by viewers, featuring accidents filmed using the latest technology only - no camcorder clips or pixelated phone videos in sight. Featuring a man being accidentally Tasered, a couple setting their kitchen on fire, and a toddler in an electric car running amok in a shopping centre

programme.title: For Your Eyes Only (1981)
programme.desc: James Bond goes in search of a British weapons system aboard a sunken vessel before it falls into the hands of enemies who will use it to deactivate all Western submarines. Unfortunately, his mission is hindered by a crossbow-toting woman out to avenge her father's murder. Spy thriller, starring Roger Moore, Topol, Julian Glover, Carole Bouquet, Jill Bennett and Lynn-Holly Johnson

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh host with the quiz, as Catherine Tyldesley, Levi Roots, Chris McCausland and Rick Wakeman pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: Sitting on a Fortune
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Gary Lineker, with contestants Jesse, Craig, Marie, Sharon, Ian, Chloe and Ali answering questions to remain in with a chance of taking away up to £100,000. Players position themselves in a row of seats one behind another, with one wrong answer seeing them relegated to the back of the line and in real danger of leaving with nothing

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.desc: Stephen Fry presents a documentary looking at the impact of the seasons on wildlife, with first edition examining winter in the northern hemisphere and summer in the southern. On Norwegian archipelago Svalbard's frozen sea-ice, a polar bear mother prepares her cub for a life alone, while Marion Island in the Indian Ocean between South Africa and Antarctica becomes home to a million penguins as breeding season starts

programme.title: A Spy Among Friends
programme.desc: After Soviet double agent Kim Philby defects to the USSR in 1963, his friend and former MI6 colleague Nicholas Elliott comes under investigation by Lily Thomas from MI5. She tries to determine if he facilitated Philby's escape because he is also a traitor working for the Russians, or is it just that his judgement was clouded at a critical moment by their 23-year friendship? Fact-based thriller based on the book by Ben Macintyre, starring Damian Lewis, Guy Pearce and Anna Maxwell Martin

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Spice Trail Adventure
programme.desc: The actress heads off on a journey to visits important places in the spice trade, beginning by travelling to a collection of remote Indonesian islands so small that her first challenge is finding them on a map. She meets a family on the Banda Islands making their living from harvesting nutmeg, uncovers the dark history of Banda's past and discovers that its charms once attracted A-list celebrities, including Mick Jagger

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell tell more stories of people desperate to find missing family and answer questions that have haunted entire lives, beginning with two men searching for the truth about their beginnings. Paul Connolly had a brutal childhood and was put out with the rubbish as a baby in east London and raised in care, while Shaun Lawrence had a happy adoption with wonderful parents but was always curious about his birth parents

programme.title: Monster Carp
programme.desc: Neil Spooner and Tom Dove head to Croatia to fish at Lake Zajarki on the outskirts of Zagreb, with the chance of catching a carp in excess of 90lb

She tries to determine if he facilitated Philby's escape because he is also a traitor working for the Russians, or is it just that his judgement was clouded at a critical moment by their 23-year friendship? Fact-based thriller based on the book by Ben Macintyre, starring Damian Lewis, Guy Pearce and Anna Maxwell Martin

Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Rosemary and Laura are employed to restore a country churchyard in time for a medieval fair, but it is not long before a local landowner is killed by an arrow beneath an ancient yew in the centre of the graveyard. The duo investigate the possibility that rival bidders for the victim's highly desirable farm are to blame - though affairs of the heart might offer a more likely motive. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

Crime drama based on the Agatha Christie novel, starring David Suchet, with Pippa Guard, Donald Sumpter and Miranda Forbes

programme.desc: The sleuth falls asleep during a flight from Paris to London, while a female passenger is murdered by a poisoned dart, leaving few clues to the killer's identity. The investigation is turned on its head, however, when the victim's illegitimate daughter comes forward to claim the inheritance. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with David Firth, Jenny Downham and John Bleasdale

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: When the sleuth's dentist is found dead just minutes after he leaves his surgery, Chief Inspector Japp believes it to be suicide - but Poirot has reason to think otherwise and embarks on his own investigation. Drama, starring David Suchet

Drama, starring Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes, with James Callis, William Gaunt and Raquel Cassidy

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A barrister is killed with a lethal dose of morphine and suspicion falls on ex-convict Grady Felton, who has recently returned to the village where he committed murder years earlier. However, he has a strong alibi and Barnaby thinks he must be working with an accomplice - until Grady himself is targeted in an arson attack. Detective drama, guest starring Sharon Duce, with Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes

programme.desc: Whicher is hired by his one-time political master, former home secretary Edward Shore, to investigate threats made against his son Charles, who has recently returned to London from India with his young family. Shore fears entanglement in a scandal could have devastating repercussions for his career and insists the detective carry out the investigation without involving his former Met colleagues, even after a murder occurs. Whicher's pursuit of justice takes him to the most dangerous corners of the Docklands, but also brings him into contact with a woman who starts to melt his long-frozen heart. Victorian crime drama, starring Paddy Considine, with Nicholas Jones, John Heffernan and Tim Pigott-Smith

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef arrives in the riverside town of L'Isle-sur-la-Sorgue in south-eastern France, where his culinary hero Keith Floyd once owned a restaurant. Buying produce from its floating market, and a Floyd-style hat, James sets up his mobile kitchen on a bridge overlooking the river, and cooks peaches pain perdu in the sunshine. Heading back in the direction of the town, James samples some truffle-laden dishes at renowned restaurant La Beaugraviere

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Chef Gino D'Acampo tours his homeland by train, taking in some of some of the most scenic train journeys in Europe. He begins in the French Alpine town of Breil-sur-Roya, so he can travel into Italy in style. Once in his own country, he meets a doctor who does his rounds on horseback, and visits hazelnut groves where he prepares a chocolate cheesecake. In Turin, he fulfils a lifelong dream of racing on top of the world-famous Lingotto rooftop track and makes his final dish - fettuccine pasta with mascarpone and pork mince

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: For the next leg of his journey, Gino D'Acampo boards an old steam train run by ex-railroad men and volunteers which takes him through the beautiful Tuscan countryside. His first stop is the town of Asciano, where locals try to compete with Siena's famous Palio horse race - only here they ride donkeys. Then it's on to the Chianti region where he visits a vineyard where they don't only make wine, but they also bathe in it too, an ancient tradition dating back to Roman times. After a luxurious wine bath, Gino cooks up a dish fit for any Emperor - farfalle pasta with funghi and spinach

programme.title: Frogmore House: Royal Retreat
programme.desc: For centuries the idyllic royal estate of Frogmore, nestling in landscaped grounds of Home Park just half a mile from Windsor Castle, has been the private escape for generations of royals going back to Queen Charlotte, the wife of the George III. Royal journalists and historians reveal extraordinary hidden stories that include the shocking incarceration at Frogmore House of the six daughters of George III and Queen Charlotte

programme.title: Sophie: The King's Secret Weapon?
programme.desc: A look at the Duchess of Edinburgh's role in the royal family, with archive footage and insight from historians, insiders and journalists. The film reveals her early life growing up in a Kent village and how she met Prince Edward through her job in PR, and recounts the difficulties she faced from the paparazzi when she became his girlfriend

programme.title: Top of the Box

Christopher Timothy and Peter Davison recall how All Creatures Great and Small made them famous, Nicholas Parsons reflects on presenting Sale of the Century, Grange Hill star Todd Carty remembers the launch of the long-running children's show, and The Sweeney producer Ted Childs recalls the end of the police drama, and a memorable cameo by Morecambe and Wise

programme.title: TV's Biggest Gameshows: 50 Years of Fun
programme.desc: A look at the history of the genre, discovering how the humble quiz went from schedule filler to a staple of primetime, featuring interviews with hosts, producers and creators. programme.title: Great British Ships
programme.desc: The Mayflower transported the first English Puritans from Plymouth to the New World in 1620. The Pilgrims and the ship's crew overcame almost impossible odds to establish a colony, which ultimately gave birth to the United States of America. Taking to the waters off the New England coast, Rob Bell recounts the dramatic story of the Mayflower's 66-day crossing, as she endured high seas and monstrous storms. In Mystic,Connecticut, Rob explores a full-sized replica of the Mayflower and in Plymouth, Massachusetts, unfolds the story of the ship's arrival in the New World

programme.desc: The chief yeoman warder oversees the tower's celebration of the end of the First World War, and special preparations are made for the tower director's retirement party, involving a military band and a unique farewell as he leaves the tower for the last time. programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: The new tower director starts work on the same day that Donald Trump visits London, while curator Eleri Lynn goes in search of a recently rediscovered royal treasure - the last surviving dress made for Elizabeth I, which has turned up in a small village church in Herefordshire. programme.desc: Through interviews with ex-inmates, retired guards and relatives of Britain's most infamous inmates, this documentary uncover secrets of life inside one of the UK's toughest jails. Exclusive phone calls from one of the UK's longest-serving inmates, Charles Bronson, reveal first-hand what life is really like as inmate in Wakefield Prison, and there are never-before-told stories from inside the walls of Wakefield about Jeremy Bamber, arguably as famous for his fight to get out of prison as for the crimes he committed to be sent there
