programme.desc: A law-abiding Arizona rancher runs into trouble when he unwittingly makes an enemy of a neighbouring landowner, who resents him for having befriended and comforted his abused mistress. The jealous man then recruits nine gunmen in a bid to drive his rival out of the territory. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Richard Boone, Donna Martell and Jocelyn Brando

programme.title: Gideon of Scotland Yard (1958)
programme.desc: Police inspector George Gideon experiences an eventful day's work. He learns one of his detectives has accepted bribes, goes on the trail of a murderous maniac and tracks a woman suspected of robbery. He also helps foil a bank heist and gets off on the wrong foot with an eager young constable. John Ford's drama, starring Jack Hawkins, Dianne Foster, Anna Lee and Anna Massey

programme.title: Sahara (2005)
programme.desc: An explorer stumbles upon evidence that an American Civil War battleship, which was laden with treasure when it sank without trace, has ended up somewhere in the Sahara. However, he is deflected from his mercenary quest to find the hoard by an encounter with a tenacious doctor, whose battle to stop the spread of a deadly disease could be linked to his own mission. Adventure, starring Matthew McConaughey, Penelope Cruz and Steve Zahn

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout Interview Special
programme.desc: Stars Tom Cruise, Rebecca Ferguson, Henry Cavill, Simon Pegg, Vanessa Kirby and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about making the sixth instalment in the franchise

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Rogue Nation (2015)
programme.desc: The team of secret agents faces being shut down when the head of the CIA convinces the US Senate that it is too dangerous. The operatives of the Impossible Mission Force become fugitives when they defy orders and plot to bring down a shadowy society of assassins. Spy thriller sequel, starring Tom Cruise, Jeremy Renner, Rebecca Ferguson and Simon Pegg

programme.title: The Equalizer (2014)
programme.desc: A retired secret agent applies his talents to the task of helping victims of injustice. When he witnesses a prostitute being beaten up by a pimp, he kills the man, an act that draws him into a battle to the death with a Russian crime syndicate. Action thriller based on the 1980s TV series, starring Denzel Washington and Chloe Grace Moretz

programme.title: Drunk Wedding (2015)
programme.desc: A couple's marriage at a resort in Nicaragua is ruined when their college friends get drunk on tequila and the ir big day descends into an orgy of excessive boozing, embarrassing revelations, sexual opportunism and general bad behaviour. Comedy, starring Christian Cooke, Nick P Ross and JR Ramirez

programme.title: Carry On Regardless (1961)
programme.desc: A businessman starts up an odd-job agency, but employs seven hopeless handymen incapable of completing any task without causing utter chaos. Matters come to a head when their landlord tries to evict them - forcing the bungling workmen to finally prove their worth. Slapstick comedy, starring Sid James, Charles Hawtrey and Kenneth Williams

programme.title: Playing with Fire (2019)
programme.desc: A straight-laced fire superintendent and his elite team of expert firefighters come to the rescue of three siblings in the path of an encroaching wildfire, but quickly realise that no amount of training could prepare them for their most challenging job yet - as their babysitters. Comedy, starring John Cena, Keegan-Michael Key and John Leguizamo

programme.title: Hotel for Dogs (2009)
programme.desc: An orphaned brother and sister face losing their beloved dog when they go into a foster home that does not allow pets. The kids find the ideal hiding place in an abandoned hotel, and set about transforming it into luxury canine accommodation for not just their beloved pet, but every stray in town. Family comedy, starring Emma Roberts, Jake T Austin, Don Cheadle and Lisa Kudrow

programme.title: Bride Wars (2009)
programme.desc: Two lifelong best friends discover their weddings have been scheduled on the same day and at the same venue. Neither is prepared to back down, so a bitter rivalry ensues as years of friendship are cast aside in the struggle to sabotage each other's big day. Comedy, starring Kate Hudson, Anne Hathaway, Candice Bergen and Chris Pratt

programme.title: Mission: Impossible (1996)
programme.desc: Secret agents suspect there is a traitor in their organisation when their latest assignment ends in disaster. The sole survivor is accused of being the mole, forcing him to go on the run to clear his name. However, in the process, he discovers a former Russian spy is selling information about the world's leading undercover operatives. Action thriller based on the 1960s TV series, starring Tom Cruise, Jon Voight and Ving Rhames

programme.title: The Bone Collector (1999)
programme.desc: A quadriplegic ex-cop is saved from the brink of suicide by a rookie female officer needing his expertise to form a psychological profile of a serial killer. The murderer is posing as a cab driver and terrorising Manhattan, and has a gruesome habit of taking trophies from his victims' bodies. Thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Angelina Jolie, Michael Rooker, Mike McGlone, Luis Guzman and Queen Latifah

programme.title: The Equalizer 2 (2018)
programme.desc: Robert McCall divides his time between cab driving and looking after a young man who is mixing with a bad crowd. When a CIA friend is murdered, the former black ops agent sets out to avenge her death, and winds up fighting for survival in his hurricane-battered home town. Action thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Pedro Pascal and Ashton Sanders

programme.title: Train to Busan (2016)
programme.desc: Hedge-fund manager Seok-woo sets off on a train journey with his small daughter, but as their train is about to leave the station a very sick passenger stumbles aboard - affected by a chemical spill that turns creatures and people into zombies. The virus spreads fast from carriage to carriage, and Seok-woo must join with other unaffected passengers and fight to save his own life and that of his child. South Korean horror, starring Yoo Gong and Yu-mi Jung. In Korean and Hawaiian

programme.title: Zulu (1964)
programme.desc: An upper-class soldier and his fellow officer stationed at Rorke's Drift in 1879 discover they have been cut off after the destruction of the main British army column in the area. They must rally their small force of 140 men against the might of 4,000 Zulu warriors advancing on their position. Fact-based historical drama, starring Michael Caine, Stanley Baker, Jack Hawkins, Ulla Jacobsson, Nigel Green and Chief Buthelezi, with narration by Richard Burton

programme.title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid: The Long Haul (2017)
programme.desc: Youngster Greg Heffley hatches a plot to re-route a family road trip towards a videogame convention. Comedy sequel, starring Jason Drucker, Alicia Silverstone and Tom Everett Scott

programme.title: Stardust (2007)
programme.desc: A young shop assistant in Victorian England enters a magical parallel world in search of a fallen star to give to the girl of his dreams. However, the star in question is in fact a beautiful woman, who he helps flee from a wicked witch and a murderous prince. Fantasy adventure, based on Neil Gaiman's novel, with Charlie Cox, Claire Danes, Michelle Pfeiffer, Robert De Niro, Mark Strong and Sienna Miller. Narrated by Ian McKellen

programme.title: Mission: Impossible 2 (2000)
programme.desc: Secret agent Ethan Hunt sent to find and destroy the only sample of a deadly man-made virus. However, he faces tough opposition in a former spy-turned-criminal mastermind who has already acquired the cure and now wants the pathogen itself. Director John Woo's action thriller sequel, starring Tom Cruise, Dougray Scott, Thandie Newton and Anthony Hopkins

programme.title: The Hitman's Bodyguard (2017)
programme.desc: A disgraced bodyguard is hired to protect a hitman about to testify against the tyrannical president of Belarus at the International Criminal Court in exchange for the release of his wife from prison. Comedy action thriller, starring Ryan Reynolds, Samuel L Jackson, Gary Oldman and Salma Hayek

programme.title: Insidious: The Last Key (2018)
programme.desc: A parapsychologist returns to her family home to investigate supernatural disturbances. Fourth instalment in the horror saga, starring Lin Shaye, Angus Sampson, Leigh Whannell and Spencer Locke

programme.title: Corpus Christi (2019)
programme.desc: When a 20-year-old criminal experiences a spiritual transformation after his release from prison, he decides to minister a small-town parish, which also offers an opportunity for the local community to begin the healing process after a tragedy that happened there. Drama, starring Bartosz Bielenia, Aleksandra Konieczna and Eliza Rycembel. In Polish

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: The villagers mourn for Juliet at her funeral, but one important guest is nowhere to be found. Later, Ella receives an anonymous gift

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Leela gets her daughter's approval, Donna-Marie takes things too far, and Charlie is left feeling confused about what he wants

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Boca Raton in Florida to turn around the fortunes of Italian restaurant Anna Vincenzo's. The owner opened the establishment in 2001 with the help of her father but the business has failed to meet her expectations, and the chef realises that her ruthless style of management is having an adverse influence, not only on her staff but also on her family

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to Newbury Park in southern California to help Mexican restaurant Mama Rita's. The owner previously ran a successful catering company but has struggled to adapt her skills to meet the demands of a new business - and with a year's worth of food stored in the freezer Gordon realises he has a tough job ahead

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Dr Sturgis is discharged from hospital, but after returning home he unexpectedly calls a halt to his relationship with Meemaw. US comedy, starring Wallace Shawn and Annie Potts

programme.title: Young Sheldon

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is distraught when his online gaming account is hacked, so his friends decide to find out who is responsible. However, they make the disastrous mistake of confronting the culprit in person. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy and Sheldon start a gossip experiment to see how quickly rumours spread among the gang, while Howard tells his friends he is planning to propose to Bernadette - not realising Raj is wrestling with his own feelings for her. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Mayim Bialik and Johnny Galecki

programme.title: Modern Family

Elsewhere, Mitchell and Manny learn they have more in common than they thought during a trip to watch a meteor shower with Jay. Comedy, starring Ty Burrell and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Penny agree to participate in an unusual experiment, and Leonard, Amy, Raj and Emily spend the evening trying to escape from a 'zombie'. Elsewhere, Howard and Bernadette run into trouble at the airport after returning from Mrs Wolowitz's funeral. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Trouble arises when Amy learns that Sheldon has applied for a one-way mission to colonise Mars. Meanwhile, Leonard surprises Penny with a gift, and Raj decides to snoop around Emily's flat after she is called back to work during their evening together. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

However, he soon changes his mind when he finds out that Star Trek: The Next Generation actor Brent Spiner will also be there

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon's mother comes to visit and woos the gang, but he cannot help feeling jealous of all the attention she is receiving - until a bout of illness lays him low, and he suddenly sees the benefits of having her around. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Dave convinces Calvin to hold a yard sale, but when a long time neighbourhood resident purchases a valuable object, Calvin he enlists Dave to help him get it back

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: When Tina agrees to give Grover piano lessons and her son Malcolm lands a job in retail sales, neither Butler has a first day that goes quite according to plan

programme.title: Modern Family

Comedy, starring Julie Bowen and Jesse Tyler Ferguson

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Tired of the family's obsession with electronic gadgets, Claire and Phil declare a household challenge to see who can stay unplugged the longest. Mitch and Cameron frantically try to get Lily into the best pre-school, while Jay and Manny are concerned at the lengths to which Gloria will go to stop the neighbour's dog barking

programme.title: Young Sheldon

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard worries his lack of American football knowledge is alienating him from Penny and her friends. However, he finds an unlikely sporting tutor in the form of Sheldon, who reluctantly spent most of his childhood attending games with his father. Meanwhile, Raj is infuriated when Howard abandons him to pursue a girl at a kite-fighting contest

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: A jealous Leonard argues with Penny when she invites one of her male friends to stay at her apartment while he is in town. Unfortunately, the row brings up unpleasant memories for Sheldon of watching his warring parents, causing even more tension between the friends. Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard meets up with the woman he kissed during his trip in the hope of setting Penny's mind at ease, while Sheldon films a special episode of Fun with Flags after his break-up with Amy. Bernadette feels guilty about keeping a secret from Penny

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys' science skills are put to the test when they get a flat tyre during Leonard's surprise bachelor party weekend in Mexico. Meanwhile, the girls finally force Penny to break the news to her family that she has eloped with Leonard. Keith Carradine guest stars

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: It is prom day at Hollyoaks High, and a familiar face returns wanting to help her friend by playing Cupid. Charlie finds himself between two broken hearts

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade and comedian Ellie Taylor head to the Spanish capital for a two-day break, following an itinerary rich in art, history, histrionics and ham. The pair go on a guided tour in which they view masterpieces by Bosch, Velasquez, Picasso and Dali, before they attend a ham-carving workshop and a sample a five-course tasting menu, of which four courses are pork or ham, including a tartare dish. They also take in a lively boating lake, a circus church and a grisly tour of the Spanish Inquisition

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Sales administrator Millie from Newquay says she has exhausted the local dating pool and is hoping to find herself the perfect partner. Sheffield window cleaner Alex was bullied in his teens for being overweight. He has trained hard to get a body he is proud of and now he is looking for someone who feels the same. Anna Richardson invites them both to choose a date from a selection of six naked people, whose bodies are revealed one section at a time

programme.title: Naked Attraction

London student James, 22, loves clubbing and has a penchant for heels and glitter but he seems to be scaring off the guys. Will any of the men hidden away behind the screens be open-minded enough for him? Anna Richardson reveals all

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys work as bellhops, serve up trouble as hot dog vendors, and go head-to-head presenting odd inventions to a focus group

programme.title: Impractical Jokers

programme.title: The Neighborhood

programme.title: The Neighborhood

programme.title: Supernanny US

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Groom-to-be Sam aims for a celebration inspired by pixies, although his fiancee Luanne dreams of a traditional wedding like the one her parents had

programme.desc: The chef takes on one of his toughest challenges yet, J Willy's Bar and Grille in South Bend, Indiana, which has amassed debts of more than $1million. programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

The head chef's attitude to quality control is driving customers away, and it is up to Gordon Ramsay to turn the business around

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire is stuck at an airport and needs to track down Haley, who has gone missing following an argument, so she logs on to her laptop and checks in with the rest of the family in the hope of making amends with her daughter. Julie Bowen stars in a novel episode filmed entirely on Apple devices, with Ty Burrell, Ed O'Neill and Sarah Hyland

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay and Claire shoot an advert to rival a competitor's catchy new campaign - but creative differences threaten to tear the father and daughter apart. Phil, Luke and Manny join forces to take down a Peeping Tom who has been using a drone to spy on a sunbathing Gloria, Cam worries about Lily's lack of singing skills ahead of a talent show, and Haley has a confession for Andy when he's rushed to hospital with appendicitis

programme.title: Modern Family

Steven Spielberg's animated adventure based on Herge's comic-strip series, with the voices of Jamie Bell, Andy Serkis and Daniel Craig

programme.desc: Sheldon is given the chance to square off against the one actor from the Star Trek franchise he holds a grudge against - Wil Wheaton. Meanwhile, Leonard asks Penny to set Howard up on a date with one of her friends. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard worries his lack of American football knowledge is alienating him from Penny and her friends. However, he finds an unlikely sporting tutor in the form of Sheldon, who reluctantly spent most of his childhood attending games with his father. Meanwhile, Raj is infuriated when Howard abandons him to pursue a girl at a kite-fighting contest

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: A jealous Leonard argues with Penny when she invites one of her male friends to stay at her apartment while he is in town. Unfortunately, the row brings up unpleasant memories for Sheldon of watching his warring parents, causing even more tension between the friends. Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons star

programme.title: Star Trek Beyond (2016)
programme.desc: The USS Enterprise sets out on a rescue mission which turns out to be a deadly trap set by a mysterious warlord. The crew are left stranded on an unexplored planet, and join forces with a fugitive alien scavenger to find a way off the hostile world and prevent a terrible weapon being unleashed upon the galaxy. Sci-fi adventure, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto and Idris Elba

programme.title: Kingsman: The Golden Circle (2017)
programme.desc: Having saved the world once, secret agents Eggsy and Merlin join forces with their US counterparts to bring down a psychotic femme fatale. Thankfully they are assisted by a veteran hero brought back from the dead, and cross paths with a kidnapped Elton John and a couple of killer robot dogs along the way. Director Matthew Vaughn's comedy adventure sequel, starring Taron Egerton, Colin Firth, Mark Strong and Julianne Moore

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson meets 24-year-old fitness fanatic Rose, whose body has been getting all the attention in the gym while her love life has been neglected. She is bored of being one of the lads and hopes to be seen for all that she is. Next up is Clarissa, a 22-year-old barista from Basingstoke who is looking for her dream woman. Will either of tonight's singletons pick the right date when everything is stripped back to basics?

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Programmes including The Andrew Marr Show, I'm a Celebrity, Get Me Out of Here!, The Snowman, First Dates, The Apprentice and The Secret Life of the Zoo come under the armchair critics' gaze as they share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week. The programme captures their instant reactions and lively discussions from the comfort of their own homes. First aired in December 2018

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Fitness fanatic Jade, 24, sits down for a meal with Jak, 29, a yoga lover in touch with his spiritual side and who shares her love of exercise and tattoos, while fashion stylist Christine, 70, and entrepreneur Peter, 71, share stories of the Swinging Sixties. Health club manager Donna, 51, is a born romantic with old fashioned values at heart and her date is 53-year-old stetson-wearing Simon from Dallas, Texas, who's happy to stand out from the crowd and is looking for a strong woman to stand by his side

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire is stuck at an airport and needs to track down Haley, who has gone missing following an argument, so she logs on to her laptop and checks in with the rest of the family in the hope of making amends with her daughter. Julie Bowen stars in a novel episode filmed entirely on Apple devices, with Ty Burrell, Ed O'Neill and Sarah Hyland

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay and Claire shoot an advert to rival a competitor's catchy new campaign - but creative differences threaten to tear the father and daughter apart. Phil, Luke and Manny join forces to take down a Peeping Tom who has been using a drone to spy on a sunbathing Gloria, Cam worries about Lily's lack of singing skills ahead of a talent show, and Haley has a confession for Andy when he's rushed to hospital with appendicitis

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Joel keeps a huge secret from Leela, the village comes together to mourn Juliet, DeMarcus receives a surprise phone call ad the teenagers get ready for their prom

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp is taught how to bind books by expert Isabelle Ting, and reveals how to create a notebook from leftover materials including leather offcuts, recycled leather coats and decorative paper

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Donna and Martin, from Dagenham, east London, seek a holiday home for the whole family to enjoy on the stunning Costa Dorada in Spain. They have a budget of £65,000 and want a one-bedroom apartment with outside space close to the bustling town of Salou. Jasmine Harman lines up five properties for them to consider

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: It's moving day for a couple building a house in the Italian hills, while the owners of an e-bike company take out their first paying tour. Meanwhile, in Portugal, a couple bid to finally pull off their longed-for yoga retreat

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien are in Northamptonshire and Coventry, where Henry discovers a rare limited edition Honda Goldwing motorbike with only 65 miles on the clock

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Northamptonshire in search of more upcycling prospects. Simon finds some night vision goggles and an antique snooker table that's seen better days, while Henry chooses an enormous US army truck as one of his picks

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives explore the case of Brett Miller, who died aged just 39, and investigate John Woor's life story, from his time in wartime India to his experiences in the world of art. Plus, details of three more unclaimed estates

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers look for an heir to the estate of Brian Yanchuk, a man from Milton Keynes with links to 19th-century Canada and the Second World War, and an investigation into the beneficiaries of Alexander Gibson leads the team to a family secret. Plus, details of unclaimed estates where heirs are yet to be found

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Inn at the Park in Aberdeen, where for owners Ronnie and Steph Caird, it's all about keeping it in the family. When the guests arrive, design-conscious father and son Steve and Allard take a trip back in time, and John isn't flushed with praise for his bathroom. At dinner, John reveals his culinary background, piling on the pressure for Ronnie to deliver a good breakfast. Fiona and Shauna's sizeable confession raises eyebrows, while in the morning, Ronnie has a breakfast to forget and the bathroom blues leave Ronnie and Steph seeking answers from their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Ingliston Country Club in Renfrewshire, where events manager Shauna Kirk and sales manager Fiona Gallagher prove a force to be reckoned with. Guests Steve and Allard aren't feeling the dated décor, and John proves that one size doesn't fit all. Ronnie and Steph are blown away by the competition, but they think that perfection comes at a price

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit, the group heads to 1692 Wasdale in the Lake District, where owners Steve and Allard Newell have proudly built their B&B from the ground up

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests stay at the Lynbar Hotel in Blackpool, where Ronnie and Steph have parking problems, while confident owner John O'Donnell boasts of serving the best breakfast in town

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to settle some scores. Inn at the Park owners Ronnie and Steph Caird are intent on clearing up John's issues with the toilet

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Cameras follow Chester Zoo's four new fledgling Humboldt penguins who are being brought up apart from the main colony until they're old enough to compete for fish in the main pool. They're keen to make a break for it and join the adults, but when they're finally free to go they have other ideas. Elsewhere, Niall the chimpanzee keeper has known chimp Boris for 44 years. When the ape captures a moorhen chick, Niall must use his powers of persuasion to negotiate the safe release of his hostage

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Poodle cross Wally is struggling to find a forever home, having spent a year in the centre during which time he has had four unsuccessful attempts. But the staff remain confident someone will come along who is able to handle his tricky behaviour. Meanwhile, bichon frise Bruce is looking for a quiet home and a comfy lap. Will he find that with Janet from Sheffield, who wants a well-behaved dog to keep her company after the death of her husband?

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: After a four-year stint living in New Zealand, ex-RAF pilot Jon and GP Gill Flewers want to build a Kiwi-style hill house on the slopes of the Malvern hills in Worcestershire. They plan to build an ambitious three-storey home clad in wood and stone, but the pair encounter problems as the site is so steep builders do not want to take on the job

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The hospital documentary returns, focusing on the stories of two motorcyclists, which reveal how the bonds between loved ones can be strengthened through adversity. Prezmek may have life-changing spinal injuries following a high-speed motorcycle crash on the M4, forcing his wife Tatia to reflect on how their plans for the future may have to change. Teenager Leon undergoes a CT scan after crashing into a central reservation. While waiting for the results, his mother Janey thinks back to his school days

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Following three patients who have adapted to the challenges thrown their way, including 27-year-old Josh, who was rushed to A&E after being thrown from his motorbike at speed. Georgie has brought in her 10-month-old son Phoenix after she caught him sucking on a bleach tablet, while 21-year-old Ross is in A&E after dislocating his shoulder at work

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Sean Lock and Harriet Kemsley take on Jon Richardson and Joe Lycett in the words-and-numbers game, while Mat Ewins joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. Hosted by Jimmy Carr, with Rachel Riley looking after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A 71-year-old man is left with a severely broken ankle when he is knocked off his bike by a dog. Paramedic Sam Grimson and student paramedic Ayaz Ali are sent to a park in Birmingham to help. Then they respond to a call to assist a man who's been trapped for over 20 hours with a broken leg

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The hospital documentary returns, focusing on the stories of two motorcyclists, which reveal how the bonds between loved ones can be strengthened through adversity. Prezmek may have life-changing spinal injuries following a high-speed motorcycle crash on the M4, forcing his wife Tatia to reflect on how their plans for the future may have to change. Teenager Leon undergoes a CT scan after crashing into a central reservation. While waiting for the results, his mother Janey thinks back to his school days

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Following three patients who have adapted to the challenges thrown their way, including 27-year-old Josh, who was rushed to A&E after being thrown from his motorbike at speed. Georgie has brought in her 10-month-old son Phoenix after she caught him sucking on a bleach tablet, while 21-year-old Ross is in A&E after dislocating his shoulder at work

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: The team revisits favourite investigations, including Kate Quilton's visit to the world's largest producer of jelly beans to find out what goes into the sweets. Matt Tebbutt attempts to find out why tinned anchovies taste so salty, and Jimmy Doherty heads to a Mauritius distillery as he explores the secrets of rum

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty investigates the sugar tax, and finds out how manufacturers have responded by reducing the sugar in some of our favourite brands, asking what exactly they are adding to keep the flavours the same. Matt Tebbutt is in Italy to find out why strange white stripes are appearing more and more often on chicken breasts, and Kate Quilton asks why some sliced bread falls apart when it's buttered, while other such loaves stay firm

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Hilary and Alan from Liverpool have been married for almost 40 years and have long been dreaming about relocating to Spain. Now that the time is finally right for them to make the big move, they've asked Jasmine Harman to find them their perfect new home in the ever-popular region of Alicante. Working to a £160,000 budget, can Jasmine find exactly what Hilary and Alan are looking for?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman scours the property market in eastern Mallorca for choir-mistress Tina from Maidenhead, Berkshire. Tina is originally from Germany; she has lived in the UK for 30 years but now dreams of retiring to sunnier climes. She has a budget of £150,000 and is looking for a new forever home close to the sea, where her two grown-up children can also come to visit. Her son, musician Jamie, is accompanying her on the search

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Tracey and Iain from south Wales are looking to buy a holiday home in Ibiza after they fell in love with the island on a family holiday six years ago. They're especially drawn to the pretty town of Santa Eularia and have set their hearts on somewhere with a sea view, so call upon the skills of property expert Ben Hillman to find them the home of their dreams for their £275,000 budget

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: Ellie Taylor and Liam Charles welcome a new batch of pastry chefs to the tent and challenge them to create 36 individual opéra aux fruit and one chocolate amenity in three hours. For their showpiece, the teams must transform a classic banoffee pie into a fine-dining experience with edible sculptures. Benoit Blin and Cherish Finden judge

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Former property developer Ian hosts the first dinner party in Gloucestershire, hoping his super-healthy menu will win him the £1,000 prize - although it is possible his guests may be more impressed with his 12-bedroom mansion in the country. Some naked antics, a pinata and stories of millions pounds won and lost make it a night to remember

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Then-Miss Cheltenham Sophie hosts the second dinner party in Gloucestershire, hoping her evening of elegant food and pageantry will win her the £1,000 prize. The 24-year-old reveals what she does for a living to her guests, and one attendee makes a surprising confession of her own

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Rugby-loving Carmel hosts the third dinner party in Gloucestershire, and she hopes to impress with a 'Six Nations' starter, a pancetta, king prawn and chorizo main, and a Key lime pie for dessert. An attempt to charm her guests backfires when she likens Ian to a psychotic killer, and the atmosphere takes a further knock after Chris gets on the wrong side of Sophie

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: School teacher Polly, 40, hosts the fourth night of the competition in Gloucestershire, and hopes to impress her guests with a fine-dining experience. She begins with a seafood starter before serving up a meaty main course, and isn't unnerved by the fact she hasn't had any practise cooking either dish. However, her guests show off round the table and threaten to take the attention away from the night, but Ian is highly impressed with Polly's choice of entertainment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the turn of exuberant hair salon owner Chris to host the final dinner party in Gloucestershire with home-made treats on the menu, including a tiger prawn starter, venison for the main and a dessert of chocolate and walnut ice-cream. Chat around the table reveals some differing opinions after the guests make a discovery in the host's living room, and the group reflect on their time together before the winner of the cash prize is announced

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Pencader, Carmarthenshire, at the School House B&B, owned by eco-friendly married couple Jayne and Ian Hall-Edwards, who hope that their environmental approach will impress their guests. At dinner, Ian reveals that his hosting skills might not be up to scratch and eyebrows are raised at straight-talking colleagues Jo and Neil. At breakfast, assumptions are made of businessman Raj

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Cathedral 73 in Cardiff, managed by Neil Chidzey. On arrival, guests are wowed by the glamorous rooms, but Raj is shocked to find breakfast is not included

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at Leafy Suburban B&B in Northwood, Hertfordshire, where the guests spend the afternoon taking a swing at some golfing

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to the Wellington Inn, Hertfordshire, where Felicity Rainbow takes a spiritual approach, cleansing the aura of the rooms and encouraging guests to feel the vibe

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. The School House B&B is first and host Jayne Hall-Edwards takes guests back to basics over her green policy. Next, Neil Chidzey and Jo Goodwin from Cathedral 73 challenge their guests over costings

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw head to Stockport to take on a 1994 Vauxhall Cavalier Turbo owned by Darren. After a horrific accident, Darren was left tetraplegic and unable to move from the neck down. Darren's condition has meant his Cavalier ended up on the front drive. Darren's friends are hoping that Car SOS are able to convert the car to allow him to be a passenger and satisfy his need for speed again

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and the team visit the village of Strelley in Nottinghamshire, on a quest to find the long-lost medieval castle of a knight from the 14th century. Sampson de Strelley came from a long line of knights and rose to become the Sheriff of Nottinghamshire, but the castle he built has vanished from the landscape

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 56-year-old woman is rushed to St George's with an open ankle fracture after falling in her garden, and a man suffering chest pains looks back on his career on the railway, which was cut short by a leg amputation. An 84-year-old man collapses at home following a bout of dizziness, and his children reflect on the challenges of watching his health decline in recent years

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A doctor shares his story of leaving his family and newborn child during lockdown to keep them safe. An 11-year-old hit by a car shows signs of possible internal bleeding, and a 60-year-old woman is injured after tripping over her cat. A footballer being treated for injuries to his achilles tendon describes how the sport has been an escape for him during his childhood in south London

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words-and-numbers quiz, with Sean Lock and Johnny Vegas taking on guest captain Sarah Millican and Rob Beckett. Susie Dent presides in Dictionary Corner, ably assisted by Vic Reeves, and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Sean Lock is joined by Liza Tarbuck to battle guest captain Sarah Millican and team-mate Romesh Ranganathan as Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel quiz show mash-up. Susie Dent is ably assisted by Phill Jupitus in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley deals with the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 56-year-old woman is rushed to St George's with an open ankle fracture after falling in her garden, and a man suffering chest pains looks back on his career on the railway, which was cut short by a leg amputation. An 84-year-old man collapses at home following a bout of dizziness, and his children reflect on the challenges of watching his health decline in recent years

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A doctor shares his story of leaving his family and newborn child during lockdown to keep them safe. An 11-year-old hit by a car shows signs of possible internal bleeding, and a 60-year-old woman is injured after tripping over her cat. A footballer being treated for injuries to his achilles tendon describes how the sport has been an escape for him during his childhood in south London

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty visits a green bean plantation in Kenya to find out how they grow the beans so straight for the supermarkets, and finds out what happens to those that don't make the grade. At a Norwegian scallop farm, Matt Tebbutt braves the icy waters of the North Sea to join the divers harvesting scallops by hand from the seabed, and Kate Quilton tries to unravel a mystery about Cornwall's most famous local delicacy

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: Will Hardie and George struggle to bring ancient Roman technology back to life and the build on their log cabin in the wilderness begins in earnest, while the road trip around Italy takes in an impressive fire station. The architect also meets David Moreton, a former Paralympic swimmer hoping to turn an old air ambulance into an amphibious crash pad for his charity fundraising tours, and DIY enthusiasts Ben and Michelle, who want to build a summerhouse for free, using hundreds of disused shipping pallets

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: George is joined by leading architects to help transform some of Britain's most unloved houses into desirable properties. The team meet Simon and Lisa, who recently bought a building in rural Gloucestershire in such a shoddy state that neighbours compared it to the house in Amityville Horror. George teams the couple up with creative architect Laura Clark, who attempts to turn this terrifying building into a warm and welcoming, modern home, whilst retaining some of its original character

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George tackles two very different properties from the Georgian architectural period. First, he visits a townhouse in Yorkshire, which features high ceilings, a grand staircase and a heavy chandelier hanging from the original ceiling. Later, he travels to the Peak District, where he comes across a farmhouse which is in desperate need of a transformation

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition comes from in and around Brighton. The first host, 47-year-old radio presenter Guy, plans a musical evening with a Mexican menu and an air guitar competition. His guests are 26-year-old recruitment company director Emma, 28-year-old pilot Tim, 38-year-old personal trainer Hannah and 50-year-old 'love doctor' Monti. Guy hosts a hilarious evening with lessons in love, surprising revelations and a dessert that doesn't go to plan

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the second day in and around Brighton, and bubbly 26-year-old Emma is hosting a beach-themed dinner party in the hope of winning the £1,000 cash prize. After a day of forgotten ingredients and culinary calamities, Emma has some questions up her sleeve to help her find out more about 'love doctor' Monti. Dutch pilot Tim is also feeling the love, as a bromance begins to blossom

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition continues in and around Brighton, as Dutch pilot Tim draws on his travel experience to produce an international menu. After a turbulence-free day in the kitchen, Tim continues to charm his guests, especially DJ Guy

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Personal trainer Hannah reveals quite a lot more about herself to her guests. There are no shortage of shocks and surprises as layer after saucy layer is peeled away from the usually quiet and reserved host, but there's sauciness of a different kind when one guest annoys the others by defiantly adding their own condiments to each of the three courses

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final night of competition in and around Brighton, sees 50-year-old 'love doctor' Monti try to cast his spell over his guests in an attempt to win the £1000 cash prize. While Monti tries to spread the love, Tim really puts his foot in it as his compliment to Hannah gets well and truly lost in translation

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Ship Inn in Dymchurch, Kent, where James Tindall and Jessica Walton hope to impress their guests and be named best value for money

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Thompson Hall Retreat in Norfolk, boasting stylish shepherd huts, and run by mother and daughter duo Amanda Benton and Becci Howlett

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at The White House in Swansea, where guests James and Jessica have an unusual toilet encounter in their room

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Jacobs Plough in Bicester, Oxfordshire, run by manager Duncan Froomes and bar supervisor Ryan Hunt who like to mix banter with business

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition sees the B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and settle some scores. The Ship Inn is up first, with managers James Tindall and Jessica Walton wanting to let off steam about the surprise comments that made their visit a heated affair

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition heads to Milton Keynes, where first to host is 52-year old hypnotherapist Howard, who is hoping his fancy menu will go down with his guests. However, with dishes including 'red treacle tart' his visitors are unsure what to expect, and not everyone shares the thrill when Howard introduces his 'Pendulum of Truth' to the proceedings

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Louise hosts the second night in Milton Keynes, where she hopes to wow her guests with her 'fabulous' menu - including bruschetta and mousse. However, the outspoken PA receives criticism from her guests - will she be able to overcome it to secure the prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Management consultant David hosts the third dinner party in Milton Keynes, and his guests are impressed when he introduces some dancing Las Vegas showgirls. However, with all his focus on entertainment, David makes a major blunder with the food and serves vegetarian Helen a meat dish

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Customer services manager and vegetarian Helen hosts the fourth night of the competition in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, and hopes that an East meets West-themed night will win her the £1,000 prize. Hypnotherapist Howard is intrigued by some items he finds in her bedroom, while salesman Simon enjoys her entertainment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final evening in Milton Keynes and the dinner party is thrown by salesman Simon, who believes that his night of fine dining will impress the critical guests. However, things begin to go awry when Howard embarks on a mission to throw his plans off course, and Helen discovers a collection of awards that evidence the host's competitive nature. Meanwhile, Louise finally comes clean about her dislike of David, before the votes are cast and the winner is announced

programme.title: PopMaster TV
programme.desc: Ken Bruce presents a TV version of the famous radio quiz. Each episode features five players, testing their musical knowledge to win a place in the grand final

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A rugby player is scanned for spinal damage following a collision during a match, and describes her struggles with mental health issues as she awaits the results. A teacher is knocked off his bicycle after receiving some bad news, while a man who broke two bones in his ankle after a fall is assisted by his dead wife's best friend

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: Nurse Elle and Dr Steve suspect a cyclist with a broken leg could be masking other injuries, and Dr Michelle and Dr Jonathan examine a 67-year-old motorcyclist

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Medics fly to the aid of mountain biker Rob in the Cumbrian mountains. Off-road motorbiker Dean is set to miss his friend's 50th birthday celebrations after taking a nasty tumble. Plus, 15-year-old Robbie needs urgent care when he falls from a coastal cliff in South Shields

programme.title: The Good Doctor
programme.desc: An organ donor causes a moral dilemma for the patient and the parents, while a teenage patient hopes the surgical team can free her from a life of confinement at home

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A woman hits her head collapsing in a bus shelter, and a paramedic with a phobia of mannequins is watched over by two life-size dolls while treating a man with chest pains. An 11-month-old ends up with a deep cut to his forehead, and a 90-year-old man with stabbing pains in his chest asks the paramedics to just let him go if it's serious

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A rugby player is scanned for spinal damage following a collision during a match, and describes her struggles with mental health issues as she awaits the results. A teacher is knocked off his bicycle after receiving some bad news, while a man who broke two bones in his ankle after a fall is assisted by his dead wife's best friend

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: A selection of favourite investigations, including Jimmy Doherty heading to southern Italy to find out where the flavour comes from in his Earl Grey tea. Kate Quilton wants to know if it is true that oysters can be eaten all year round, or whether they should be avoided in the summer months, while Matt Tebbutt is in Cornwall to learn what gives clotted cream its distinctive yellow colour

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Driving Wars
programme.desc: Extreme mayhem, with Colin Murray, in the show that combines video gaming with motorsport. A group of Welsh rally enthusiasts take on a trio of car dealers.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May show off the classic luxury vehicles they bought for the price of a Ford Mondeo. The Nissan GT-R is given a workout around Japan's Fuji circuit, and entrepreneurs Peter Jones and Theo Paphitis are the Stars in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A 12-year-old boy turns up at one of the bridges on his own, claiming that his mother has been kidnapped by the cartels and he has been living on the streets

programme.title: Railroad Australia
programme.desc: This edition follows the Ghan train as it takes its 288 passengers across the continent. Plus, there is trouble on the tracks as a vital rail line is in urgent need of repair

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef journeys along the Etang de Thau, famous for its oysters and mussels, before mooring his barge in the port of Sete, where Bastille Day is being celebrated. He also rustles up seafood ragout and roast black bream before travelling on to Marseille to tackle the most famous fish dish of all - bouillabaisse

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef's epic journey from the Atlantic to the Mediterranean comes to an end as he takes the final leg of his gastronomic tour along the canal systems of southern France. programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Offbeat tourism show in which Richard Ayoade is joined by celebrity guests to enjoy the most efficient weekend break possible. He begins in Barcelona with comedienne and actress Kathy Burke, experiencing the best of this popular holiday destination in just 48 hours. The pair sample adventurous cuisine, including potatoes coated in edible clay, and a cava tasting session quickly descends into disarray. Other highlights include a visit to the Barcelona Football Club museum, a guided tricycle tour, and a trip to see the surrealist work of Catalan artist Joan Miro

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade is joined by fellow comedian Adam Hills on a whirlwind weekend in Turkey's largest city. He wants to show The Last Leg host how to holiday with ruthless efficiency, as they cross the River Bosphorus from Europe to Asia, comparing a private yacht tour with the low-price public ferry. The pair have an authentic Turkish shave at a local barbershop that turns out to be a lot closer than they were expecting, and share an awkward moment at a local bath and massage parlour. There's also a visit to the Grand Bazaar market, where both men have a go at haggling

programme.title: The Yorkshire Steam Railway: All Aboard
programme.desc: War Weekend takes place on the North York Moors Railway, celebrating the part played by the railways during the Second World War, with around 30,000 visitors expected to attend. As it turns out, the biggest battle of the weekend is with the weather, as a storm blights the final preparations. Further complications arise when a tree falls on the line, leading to a full track inspection before any trains are allowed to run. Despite the setbacks, can the team pull off one of their biggest, most important and lucrative events of the year?

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Manassas, Virginia, scene of two crucial battles during the American Civil War. In Fredericksburg, he tries bottling bourbon corn whiskey and learns how it became the nation's spirit. In Richmond, the ex-politician enjoys a tour of the Virginia state Capitol building, where he hears of the dilemma faced by one of its most famous sons, General Robert E Lee, before donning his dancing shoes for a Cotillion ball. Michael ends his journey in Jamestown, the first permanent English settlement in North America

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's Bradshaw's 1913 Handbook of Indian, Foreign and Colonial Travel leads him on railway journey through the modern south Indian states of Karnataka and Tamil Nadu. He travels from the former princely state of Mysuru, aka Mysore, to the first stronghold of the East India Company in Chennai, formerly Madras

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On a journey from Lucknow in Uttar Pradesh to Kolkata in West Bengal, Michael Portillo charts a course through India's history from the days of The East India Company to the dawn of independence. In Lucknow, he tastes the famous kebabs, stops off at Bodh Gaya, where he meditates on its Buddhist heritage, and In Kolkata, he glimpses colonial Calcutta in the grand Great Eastern Hotel

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo examines the history of the American rail network, using Appleton's General Guide to the United States and Canada of 1879 to plot his course. He begins on Manhattan Island and travels from Grand Central Terminal to the site of Ground Zero

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his great American trek, following his copy of Appleton's General Guide east from Manhattan to Long Island, and visits Brooklyn to hear the story of the construction of the world's first suspension bridge. Below ground, he investigates New York City's inaugural subway, and the dangers faced by the 'sandhogs' who built it. Progressing along the Long Island Railroad to Queens, Michael takes in an ambitious engineering project and a model town built by an Irish immigrant who became one of America's richest men. Later, he heads to the island's Gold Coast, where he relives the fun of 'the roaring twenties' at Oheka Castle, and concludes this leg of his trip at the Montauk lighthouse on Long Island's eastern-most tip

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo follows America's iconic River Hudson, beginning at New York City's Penn Station, where he rides on the national rail carrier service, Amtrak. At Tarrytown, he hears a famous American ghost story, the Legend of Sleepy Hollow, and on the east bank of the Hudson he stops at Garrison, where he hears about the greatest turncoat in American history. In Poughkeepsie, the presenter visits a university built just for women, before arriving in New York's state capital, Albany, where he samples Albany Ale and meets the State Senator

programme.title: Porridge

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Joe Lycett heads to the Austro-German border with his guest vacationer Roisin Conaty, spending a couple of days in the fairy-tale city of Salzburg. After checking in to the art-filled Blaue Ganz hotel, they hop into a horse and carriage for a tour of the city and an on-the-go three-course meal. They then embark on a forest-bathing workshop, attempting a series of exercises to reawaken their senses. Day two starts with a homage to Mozart. The duo reflect on the composer's music then sample the city's signature sweet, Mozartkulgen - aka Mozart Balls - a mix of nougat, marzipan and dark chocolate

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Head teacher Corinna hosts the first of five parties in and around Essex, hoping her royal-themed evening will impress her guests Paul, Grace, Harmy and Adam

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Forty-seven-year-old money broker Paul hosts the second dinner party in and around Essex, aiming to impress his guests with an evening of fine dining

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Teacher Harmy hosts the third night of the competition in and around Essex, hoping to impress her guests by serving up an authentic Punjabi feast

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Recruitment consultant Adam is the fourth to host in and around Essex, and hopes to exceed expectations with a menu of posh nosh at his dad's house

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The last to act as host is 24-year-old recruitment consultant Grace, who hopes to dazzle her guests with a glamorous party, Essex-style. With a menu full of home-made grub and help from her family along the way, it remains to be seen whether Grace has done enough to bag the £1,000

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at the Coachman Inn in Hartford, Cheshire, where owner Justin Hyam surprises his guests with a romantic revelation at dinner and a breakfast bombshell

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The Foxhall Village Guest House in Blackpool is this week's second venue, where the food falls short of expectations and not everyone has a good night's sleep

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at the Douglas Hotel in Hartlepool, where owner Raqeeb Ramzan and his uncle Raj Malik hope to impress their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mike and Sue Brierley welcome their rivals to Gables Pod Camping in Escomb in County Durham. Their guests are pleased with the pods, but while Justin basks in his bunk bed, Tina worries about where she's going to sleep. Over dinner, Mike and Sue's revelation about how they met amuses their guests, but the fun atmosphere is soon replaced by an awkward tension when payment day is discussed, and the evening ends with one guest on a sofa and another in a hot tub

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet up for a final showdown, as Justin gives Tina and Kay a platform for their feedback about noisy trains and seeks to know more about Raqeeb's problems with his shower. Tina and Kay want to clear up Raqeeb and Raj's cleanliness comments before discussing what really happened at breakfast. After dramatic discoveries and frank exchanges, the payments are revealed and the winner is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps Teresa Lynch search for a property in the western Algarve, Portugal. With dramatically falling house prices, she hopes her budget of £120,000 will be enough to fulfil her lifelong dream of living on the country's coast

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps Niel and Jean Soley find a holiday home that can also be used once they retire near Huelva in southern Spain. The couple have been dreaming of buying such a property for seven years and want enough space so that all their family can come to stay, and give the property expert a budget of £210,000 to work with

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps Claire Streets and Jon Jevons find a new home in the Andalusia region of Spain. With a budget of £150,000, the Nottinghamshire couple hope to find a property with enough land for them to set up a luxury camping business

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps Richard and Janie Wood search for a new property in the Almeria region of Spain on a budget of £80,000. Richard suffers from ill health and believes his pain could be alleviated by a move to warmer climes

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Denise and Stephen are finally buying their first home together in La Cala de Mijas, southern Spain, after spending a lot of time apart in their long-distance relationship. The couple dream of finding an apartment with a pool and sea views that they can enjoy with both their families. Jean Johansson lines up five options for their £140,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman helps Ian and Emily find a holiday home in Pollenca, Mallorca on a budget of £440,000

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp is in the Home Counties with Harvie and Ranjit, who have had one of the longest searches she has ever tried to crack. Zosia and David have saved hard for their first home and have been living Zosia's parents while they search. programme.title: Britain's Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: Sotheby's managing director Guy hopes to secure the listing of a £6.5million 14-bedroom, five-acre Grade II listed manor house mega home onto his books. Aston Tirrold in Oxfordshire boasts six reception rooms, a tennis court and a huge outdoor pool, and has been home to the same family since 1975. Broker Kenrick heads to Camden, north London, to try to secure the listing of an uber-modern glass building apartment with three bedrooms, three bathrooms and a 900-square-ft roof terrace

programme.title: Sarah Millican: Outsider
programme.desc: Footage from the comedian's 2016 stage show, recorded at the Brighton Dome. The plain-speaking Geordie stand-up shares her thoughts on moving to the countryside, getting a rescue dog and her struggles with irritable bowel syndrome

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The documentary following life inside an A&E department returns. Emergency care nurse Tim reflects on his role and describes the impact his GP father had on his life. Meanwhile, Pam, who has Alzheimer's, is brought in with suspected sepsis. The 82-year-old's daughter Lisa paints a picture of Pam in her early years as a lively, fun-loving woman managing a West End club. Emergency nurse practitioner Maria treats 27-year old Theo, who hurt his knee playing football

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox

programme.title: Wonders of the World I Can't See
programme.desc: Chris McCausland visits Jordan in the Middle East with actor, writer and comedian Guz Khan, to visit the magnificent ancient city of Petra. But before they head to the wonder, Chris floats for the first time in his life in the Dead Sea, and the pair almost melt during an intense facial spa treatment. In Petra itself, they haggle with shopkeepers, ride camels and listen to tales told by candlelight, before ending their trip with traditional music and a Bedouin feast

programme.title: Five Star Kitchen: Britain's Next Great Chef

Briony Williams finds herself in a bit of a jam as she interrogates an important kitchen conundrum - why dropped toast always lands the wrong side down

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fitness fanatic Claire Wier hosts the first party in Worcestershire and hopes her low-fat menu and pre-dinner exercise routines are enough to secure her the £1,000 prize. However, her guests are disappointed that the evening meal is lacking in cream, fat, oil and butter

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beauty pageant queen Pippa Langhorne throws the second party in Worcestershire, and hopes to impress her fellow diners with a sophisticated Midsummer Night's Dream-themed event. Everyone is surprised as the hostess brings out an unusual dessert, and a guest appearance by her singing dog Buddy rounds off a memorable evening

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Publican Tim Lawson hosts the third dinner party in Worcestershire, laying on a country-themed evening featuring a novel take on prawn cocktail and a creamy main course. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Teresa Cox hosts the fourth dinner party challenge from Worcestershire and sets her store on wooing the guests with a lobster starter and an extravagant main course. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Chris Sheppard hosts the final dinner party in Worcestershire, throwing a black-tie-themed evening. He impresses some of his guests with his home-made sweet chilli sauce and potato towers - although Claire Wier finds the presentation pretentious - before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In Maidenhead, Berkshire, Simon O'Brien falls in love with an old ship's carpenter's chest, while Henry Cole takes away a miniature tether car, which he hopes to get moving again

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Max McMurdo and Simon O'Brien are in Woking, Surrey, where they find a sidecar - to be transformed into a boat - and a water cylinder that Simon might make into a trendy lamp

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Herefordshire to meet former farmer Julian. Henry finds an old cattle feeder that he wants to turn into a garden bench, while Simon hatches plans to turn a vintage seed drill into a trendy dining table

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Ghislaine Maxwell: The Making of a Monster
programme.desc: Documentary profile of the sex trafficker, being told over three nights, beginning by delving into her lavish childhood in the shadow of a tyrannical father and examining if this affected the woman she was to become. Her father's death left the family penniless and ostracised, but Ghislaine's move to New York in the early 1990s, and association with a mysterious money manager, enabled her to make a new start. But at what price?

programme.title: Ghislaine Maxwell: The Making of a Monster
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on the shocking contrast between the incredible wealth and power wielded by Ghislaine Maxwell and her partner Jeffrey Epstein in American high society, and the crimes they were committing behind closed doors. They entertained presidents and princes in fabulous properties and on a private island. But there are those who claim Maxwell enticed them into that world only to feed Epstein's sexual aberrations

programme.title: Ghislaine Maxwell: The Making of a Monster
programme.desc: This instalment of the documentary charts events in the steady demise of Ghislaine Maxwell. The socialite narrowly escaped an initial police investigation into the sexual abuse of dozens of underage girls in Epstein's Florida mansion. However, her subsequent rehabilitation as an environmentalist was scuppered when she went on the offensive against an accuser. Lawyers of survivors explain their innovative strategy that forced Ghislaine into a corner. It initiated a domino effect that eventually led to an ultimate reckoning - at the criminal trial that found her guilty in December 2021

programme.title: Jon Snow: A Witness to History
programme.desc: The newsreader shares his unique experiences and what they've taught him about humanity in the course of his decades-long career as a world-renowned reporter and Channel 4 News anchor. Despite a lifetime reporting on large-scale trauma and bloodshed, Jon remains an eternal optimist, while wondering: can an individual really make a difference in this confusing and complicated world?

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: Sandi is joined by comedian and author Rosie Jones for a journey round the Midlands exploring the best staycation retreats they have to offer. The pair begin in Rutland where they stay at the Rocket Lodge, an eco-build made of upcycled grain silos that boasts a wood-fired hot-tub, a circular kitchen and a disco bathroom. In the sand dunes on a strip of the Lincolnshire coastline, the duo stay in a rebooted 70s beach house called Sandy Feet where Sandi learns that 'Netflix and chill' doesn't mean what she thinks it does. They end their trip close to the Welsh border on the Walcot Estate in a 200-year-old hideaway known as the Wheelwright's shop that once lived 20 miles away but was dismantled and transported piece by piece before being rebuilt to look exactly the same

programme.title: Location, Location, Location

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back at some of their favourite properties from the show. They begin in Cullercoats, on North Tyneside, where Mark and Suze Drummond have emotional ties to their Victorian townhouse - special memories that are making it difficult for Suzie to consider leaving. In Rushden, Northamptonshire, Susan and John Antoniou-Bailey are torn over their unique five-bedroom home. Susan loves its history and original features, but John has had enough of constantly moving between the disjointed, boxy rooms

programme.desc: A member of the public reports a car veering erratically across the M1 and Karl Jackson and Matt Cooling are sent to investigate. Jason Potts is called to a rush-hour crash on the A50, while Alex Boniface takes the lead in the pursuit of a stolen Audi

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Ant Horsley is one of a team of officers pursuing a car suspected of being linked to the drugs trade, and a high-speed and hazardous chase ensues across the Peak District. Ant is also involved when another car is pulled over near a busy junction and its driver is arrested, with police finding what they suspect to be rocks of crack cocaine and heroin parcelled up in the car

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: In Huddersfield, officers are in pursuit of a van driver who smashed his van into a parked car before fleeing, while Bob and Dan pepper spray a suspect who is not keen on being handcuffed. Chris and Chris go after a stolen car whose driver gets too close to some railings, and the Operational Support Unit deal with a suspected heroin user carrying a number of bank cards and needles

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The police interception unit attempt to stop a dangerous driver, resulting in multiple cars and a helicopter being called into action. programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Dan and Tom have their hands full with a driver who is four times over the limit and still refuses to come quietly even when he's bundled into the back of the police car. But will he be persuaded to take his medication as directed - and stop smoking?

Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Roddy McDowall and Ida Lupino

programme.desc: An army colonel who embezzled money from his superior officer to fund arms sales becomes the target of a blackmail attempt when his crimes are discovered. programme.desc: Experts Izzie Balmer and Tim Medhurst cruise around Wales in a classic car searching for antiques to sell at auction. With shopping done there's time for the duo to learn more about local history, as Izzie finds out about a shameful event that took place in the country's capital city, Cardiff and Tim takes a trip to Carmarthen to learn about the poet and scholar who helped save the Welsh language from extinction

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph heads to Walsall Recycling Centre, where she rescues a bamboo chair, a hand-made sideboard and a pair of solid wood bedside tables. With the help of upholsterer Simion Hawtin-Smith and screen print artist Daniel Heath, the tired trio of items have the chance to shine once more
