programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Legend of the Dragon
programme.desc: The guardian of the temple has passed on and a new Golden Dragon must be Chosen from a brother and sister - Twins born in the Year of the Dragon. Only one will be chosen. Their sibling bond tested

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: Sooty
programme.desc: Richard plans a show, but Sweep's bagpipes and batons cause nothing but trouble

programme.title: Sooty
programme.desc: Richard hosts a concert in the park for one of his favourite singers, but when she does not arrive, it is up to Sweep to take to the stage and give the performance of a lifetime

programme.title: Underwater World for Kids
programme.desc: An underwater adventure that takes in the many natural wonders and magical sea creatures above and below our oceans

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Bucket pays a visit to his old enemy Fagin, convinced the criminal had a part to play in the murder of Jacob Marley. The encounter sets him on the trail of Fagin's old partner in crime Bill Sikes, whose wooden cosh could provide the vital clue that will solve the case. Meanwhile, Frances comes up with an idea to ruin her sister's plans

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Kate Humble: Off the Beaten Track
programme.desc: Return of the programme in which Kate and her Welsh sheepdog Teg explore Wales' countryside. She begins in North Wales, trying to climb the tallest man-made structure in the country to fix some loose cables on the Arfon Transmission Tower. Next, Kate learns how to overcome natural obstacles with the novel activity of packrafting - using a lightweight inflatable canoe. On the north-east coast, Kate meets a pack of dogs trained to carry out wildlife conservation by sniffing out endangered species, then on the north-west coast she digs and prepares a grave for a new resident who in death wants to give himself to help nature thrive

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tour exploring Fitzrovia for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Mudlarking the Thames
programme.desc: Nicola White unearths the river's historical treasures

programme.title: The Battle of the Sexes (1960)
programme.desc: An elderly Scottish clerk tries to sabotage the new methods introduced by an American efficiency expert reorganising the old-fashioned firm where he works. However, when he realises his boss thinks the new arrival can do no wrong, he is left with just one option - murder her. Comedy, starring Peter Sellers, Constance Cummings, Roddy McMillan, Robert Morley and Jameson Clark

programme.title: Black Jack (1979)
programme.desc: A rascally French sailor is saved from hanging in 18th-century Yorkshire and sets out on the road with an apprentice, rescuing a young girl from an asylum along the way. Ken Loach's period adventure, adapted from Leon Garfield's classic children's novel, starring Jean Franval, Stephen Hirst, Andrew Bennett and Louise Cooper

programme.title: Kate Humble: Off the Beaten Track
programme.desc: Return of the programme in which Kate and her Welsh sheepdog Teg explore Wales' countryside. She begins in North Wales, trying to climb the tallest man-made structure in the country to fix some loose cables on the Arfon Transmission Tower. Next, Kate learns how to overcome natural obstacles with the novel activity of packrafting - using a lightweight inflatable canoe. On the north-east coast, Kate meets a pack of dogs trained to carry out wildlife conservation by sniffing out endangered species, then on the north-west coast she digs and prepares a grave for a new resident who in death wants to give himself to help nature thrive

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring Sudbury and Perivale for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: The gang arrive at a village where everyone has been killed by the evil Grey Gloves Devil, and an old woman insists Tripitaka is her son. Masoaki Saki and Toshiyuki Nishida star

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: William has his hands full at work when he is hired by a group of bikers to organise the perfect funeral for their friend, but at home he has wedding bells ringing in his ears as he plans a romantic evening with Mary. Rick and Molly undergo a dramatic transformation for a ballroom dancing competition and Terence ends up in hospital after a run-in with a rival gang of graffiti artists. Romantic drama, starring Martin Clunes, Julie Graham, Cheryl Campbell, Michael Begley and Dominick Baron

programme.title: Two Graves (2018)
programme.desc: A doctor kidnaps the man she believes murdered her son so she can torture him into confessing his guilt. However, her desire for vengeance leads to further tragedy and forces her to reckon with some troubling truths. Thriller, starring Cathy Tyson and David Hayman

programme.title: Forget Me Not (2011)
programme.desc: A musician comes to the aid of a barmaid being accosted by a drunk. Together they go on a journey around London and begin to fall in love, but as the night draws to a close, a secret threatens to bring their fledgling relationship to an end before it has begun. Romantic drama, with Tobias Menzies and Genevieve O'Reilly

programme.title: United (2011)
programme.desc: Drama charting the story of the 'Busby Babes' - the Manchester United side who became the youngest-ever winners of the English Football League in 1956. Having won the league again in 1957, the team reaches the quarter-finals of the European Cup in 1958 - but disaster strikes as they return from the match in Belgrade, when their charter plane crashes following a refuelling stop in Munich. The disaster claims the lives of 23 people, including eight players - and with manager Matt Busby in a critical condition, coach Jimmy Murphy tries to rebuild the shattered team. Starring David Tennant, Jack O'Connell, Sam Claflin and Dougray Scott

programme.desc: Short visual tours narrated by Dewyne Lindsay, this time exploring and revealing New Cross, Eltham, and Catford

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing Brockley, Peckham and Rotherhithe. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Dickensian

Meanwhile, Frances Barbary rekindles an old friendship and allows herself to hope that it may develop into something more

programme.title: Growing Up Poor
programme.desc: First of a two-part documentary about youngsters facing poverty, beginning with three teenage girls who are on the cusp of adulthood and are all surviving on less than £10 a day. Bridie's ambition to join the Army depends on her staying out of trouble with the police, while 16-year-old Amber has fallen pregnant, and Shelby is currently on benefits, but hopes the work placement she is on will develop into a full-time job

programme.title: Hobson's Choice (1953)
programme.desc: A cantankerous, overbearing boot-maker spends most of his time drinking while his three daughters push themselves to the limit taking care of his shop and home. A timid employee marries one of the sisters, then sets himself up as a rival for his business. Comedy, starring John Mills and Charles Laughton

programme.title: The Passing of the Third Floor Back (1935)
programme.desc: A mysterious Christ-like stranger arrives at a boarding house in London, and changes the residents' lives forever. Drama, starring Conrad Veidt, Rene Ray, Anna Lee and Frank Cellier

programme.title: The Battle of the Sexes (1960)
programme.desc: An elderly Scottish clerk tries to sabotage the new methods introduced by an American efficiency expert reorganising the old-fashioned firm where he works. However, when he realises his boss thinks the new arrival can do no wrong, he is left with just one option - murder her. Comedy, starring Peter Sellers, Constance Cummings, Roddy McMillan, Robert Morley and Jameson Clark

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Luther V Rome
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the beginnings of the Protestant Reformation, and how a simple monk challenged the might, power and money of the Vatican

programme.title: Mudlarking the Thames
programme.desc: Nicola White unearths the river's historical treasures

programme.title: The Great Way
programme.desc: Alba and Raul start their journey around the world greatest walking trails, a journey that will take them from Japan to Peru, passing through the United States

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: The story of British Airways Flight 38, which was on final approach into London Heathrow Airport when it crashed just short of the runway on 17 January 2008. What had been an uneventful passenger flight from Beijing soon turned almost fatal just moments before landing when a lack of power to both engines caused the Boeing 777 to crash. The quick thinking by the crew led by Captain Peter Burkill prevented the incident from being fatal and saved all 152 people on board

programme.title: Break (2020)
programme.desc: A petty criminal seeks sanctuary from his out-of-control life in a snooker hall, where a former champion notes his natural skill for the game. He offers him the chance to turn his life around by turning pro - but doing so will mean cutting himself off from his friends. Crime drama, starring Sam Gittins, David Yip and Rutger Hauer, in his final screen role

programme.title: Moonwalkers (2015)
programme.desc: A CIA agent travels to London in 1969 on a mission to recruit Stanley Kubrick to fake a moon landing - but is unable to locate the reclusive film-maker. A seedy rock band manager sees a chance to get rich by passing off his friend as Kubrick, but when the ruse is discovered, they have to actually shoot a fake moon landing. Comedy, starring Rupert Grint and Ron Perlman

programme.title: An Englishman in New York
programme.desc: John Hurt reprises his role as Quentin Crisp in this sequel to The Naked Civil Servant, picking up his story where the 1975 drama about the eccentric Englishman left off. Crisp sets off on the journey of a lifetime to the Big Apple, where the Americans immediately embrace the openly gay writer and his waspish ways, and before long he is being wined and dined by celebrities in every corner of Manhattan. But, as is so often the case with Quentin, he cannot resist making outrageous comments, and an ill-considered quip about the growing Aids crisis sees him suddenly dropped from high society. Sex and the City's Cynthia Nixon co-stars as performance artist Penny Arcade, with Jonathan Tucker, Denis O'Hare and Swoosie Kurtz

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton visits Gigha and Jura, two islands of the Inner Hebrides that are only a few miles apart but could not be more different. He begins at the Achamore Gardens on Gigha, which were created in the 1930s by the malted-drink millionaire James Horlick. He loved Gigha's mild climate so much that he bought the island and made it his home. Today Gigha is owned by the community, and many of its residents are incomers attracted by the opportunity to begin a new island life on this small and fertile place. Where Gigha is small, lush and verdant, Jura is rugged and awe-inspiring. Despite being one of Scotland's largest islands, just 200 people live there - alongside more than 5,000 deer

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton explores a string of islands off the west coast near Oban, visiting Kerrera, Seil and Eileach an Naoimh. The host travels on an original steam-powered puffer, finding out about the vital role such ships played in providing a link to the mainland, as well as visiting some of Scotland's oldest religious buildings

programme.title: Luther V Rome

programme.title: It Always Rains on Sunday (1947)
programme.desc: A convict escapes from prison and heads for London's East End in search of his former lover, hoping she will give him a safe hiding place. She is now married with three children, and is torn between her loyalty to her family and her unresolved feelings for the fugitive. Crime drama based on Arthur La Bern's novel, starring Googie Withers and John McCallum

programme.title: Sky West and Crooked (1965)
programme.desc: A gypsy boy falls for a fey 17-year-old girl who is treated with contempt by her fellow villagers, but the mismatched couple are soon subjected to the deep-seated prejudices of the locals. Romantic drama based on the novel by Mary Hayley Bell, starring Hayley Mills and Ian McShane

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: Mrs Peel poses as a nurse and infiltrates a home for retired railwaymen run by corrupt staff who are using a radar-jamming system to disrupt the country's defences. Diana Rigg stars

programme.title: Overlord (1975)
programme.desc: A recruit is called up for service during the Second World War. He undergoes training and gets his first experience of battle, ultimately taking part in the D-Day landings. Drama, starring Brian Stirner, Davyd Harries and Nicholas Ball

programme.title: Two Graves (2018)
programme.desc: A doctor kidnaps the man she believes murdered her son so she can torture him into confessing his guilt. However, her desire for vengeance leads to further tragedy and forces her to reckon with some troubling truths. Thriller, starring Cathy Tyson and David Hayman

programme.title: The Cat and the Canary (1978)
programme.desc: Friends and relatives of a dead millionaire gather for the reading of his will. A taped message from the deceased expresses his loathing of his legatees, and the conditions attached to the will are deliberately designed to have them at each other's throats. Moreover, it seems at least one of the potential beneficiaries is prepared to commit murder to guarantee getting the money. Thriller, starring Honor Blackman, Michael Callan and Edward Fox

programme.title: Strike It Lucky
programme.desc: Michael Barrymore hosts the madcap game show, in which three teams of two prove seek to progress along a board game-style path by answering questions. Landing on a space reveals it's hidden contents, which could amount to a prize, or a 'hot spot', which causes contestants to forfeit their gathered winnings
